description: Toyz Electronics is hiring entry-level e-commerce full-stack developers to build an e-commerce platform for teaching entrepreneurship to diverse and disadvantaged student creators. The marketplace will integrate with a Unity-based game Dah-Varsity and the companion TOYZSTEAM curriculum. Prospective applicants are preferred to have experience but not required to with ANY of the following platforms and languages; platforms:AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. Languages: JavaScript, Angular, React, SQL, NoSQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java, Python, Django, and Node JS. We are also exploring Magento Open Source and other open-source e-commerce platforms. This role will require 10 hours per week

description: Associate Software DeveloperCrafting code, creating impactBillhighway administrators support the powerful products we build for the hundreds of thousands of users of Billhighway, Chapter Spot, greekbill, and Impexium software suites. Our vision is to provide powerful solutions that help our non-profit clients improve the world. Why people love working here:Focus on personal and career development.Competitive salary, benefits, and other forms of compensation.Fresh approaches to using familiar skill sets and areas of expertise.Caring, capable leaders.Thriving culture powered by hybrid and remote team members.Our vision: Provide powerful solutions that help our non-profit clients improve the world.Our core values: Initiative, Collaboration, Reliability and Stewardship. This role: A day and week in the life…Design, develop, unit test and support the Billhighway suite of applications, using C#, SQL, JavaScript and other languages as needed.Use issue tracking systems, Jira, and source control, git, to adhere to sound engineering principles.Produce documentation of techniques used to remediate escalated issues and develop guides on how to perform essential job functions, to improve future developer experience.Collaborate with senior developers for mentoring and coaching.Handling periodic on-call duty and out-of-band requests This role: You will be successful in this role if you…Prior software developer internship experience is a plus. Have proficiency in C#, .NET framework, JavaScript and SQL through academic projects or coursework. Have familiarity with object-oriented software techniques and ER data modeling concepts.Can resolve complex issues and document root-cause analysis.Have strong communication, interpersonal and leadership skills.Recent graduate or senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in computer science, or a related field. Eligible candidates reside in one of these states: DC, FL, ID, IL, IN, MD, MI, MN, NC, NH, NJ, OH, PA, SC, TN, VA, WV.
Requirements: Design, develop, unit test and support the Billhighway suite of applications, using C#, SQL, JavaScript and other languages as needed. Use issue tracking systems, Jira, and source control, git, to adhere to sound engineering principles. Produce documentation of techniques used to remediate escalated issues and develop guides on how to perform essential job functions, to improve future developer experience. Collaborate with senior developers for mentoring and coaching. Handling periodic on-call duty and out-of-band requests

description: About Us Channel AI is a team of engineers, designers, and researchers dedicated to creating a broad and open ecosystem of useful and enjoyable AI agents that anyone around the world can use. With $22M in funding raised to date, our 13 person team includes early veterans from the world's most successful consumer social products joined by leading machine learning experts. Channel’s vision is for AI to be accessible to humanity without bias by virtue of breadth of model choice, accessibility of use, and amplification of user creativity and preferences through open agent creation. Our platform is built from the ground up to be many-agent, multiplayer, free (as in speech), and open to all.We are looking for an exceptional Backend Engineer to join our team and help revolutionize the future of how humanity interfaces with AI. At Channel AI you’ll be part of a collaborative culture, work with passionate and driven teammates, and have the opportunity to make a significant impact. This is a full-time, in-office position in downtown Palo Alto, California. ResponsibilitiesTake high level direction from VP of Engineering and CEO to create new features and systems, optimize existing ones, and work on highly diverse challenges related to the everchanging AI ecosystemManage our multi-vendor infrastructure for Generative AI model inferenceBuild data pipelines for our recommendation systemImprove system resilience and responsiveness for our usersImprove our system monitoring and error tracingQualificationsBachelor’s in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related fieldAble to solve complex problems with creative solutionsPreferred QualificationsExperience with AWS or other similar services, GPU hosting experience a plusExperience with recommendation systems, LLMs, and machine learning generallyExperience with chat or messaging applications, particularly ejabberdExperience with a scalable SQL database or NoSQL databaseWhat We OfferCompetitive Compensation: Beyond a competitive salary, we offer benefits and meaningful stock optionsGrowth: A challenging and rewarding work environment that values personal and professional growthInnovation: Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge product that's reshaping the world of human AI interfacesTeam: Join a passionate team that values transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning
Requirements: Take high level direction from VP of Engineering and CEO to create new features and systems, optimize existing ones, and work on highly diverse challenges related to the everchanging AI ecosystem Manage our multi-vendor infrastructure for Generative AI model inference Build data pipelines for our recommendation system Improve system resilience and responsiveness for our users Improve our system monitoring and error tracing, Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related field Able to solve complex problems with creative solutions, Experience with AWS or other similar services, GPU hosting experience a plus Experience with recommendation systems, LLMs, and machine learning generally Experience with chat or messaging applications, particularly ejabberd Experience with a scalable SQL database or NoSQL database

description: Location: Pittsburgh preferred, open to remoteCompany:TravelWits is an innovative, AI-powered, one-stop search and booking platform for travel agencies. As a CMU spinout, our strong technical founding team includes a world-leading expert in AI search optimization who sold another AI startup to a major robotics firm is a CMU professor, and a former Disney imagineer. With a growing team of engineers and analysts, we're scaling up quickly to revolutionize the multibillion-dollar travel industry by delivering seamless and efficient booking experiences. We are a VC-backed company with product-market fit.Role:As a startup with product-market fit, we're in a crucial phase of scaling our platform to meet increasing demand. We're seeking a talented and driven Software Engineer who will play a pivotal role in enhancing our product's scalability and performance. In addition to taking ownership of significant projects, you'll also be involved in code reviews, and high-level software design decisions. The ideal candidate is someone passionate about continuous learning and continuous improvement, with a sharp mind, quick learning abilities, and a strong grasp of software fundamentals. If you're eager to tackle challenges, help others grow, and drive scalable systems forward, we'd love to have you on our team.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate closely with the lead engineer to understand the product architecture and deliver features effectively.Take ownership of software architecture, design strategies, and coding standards.Review code to ensure quality standards and contribute to testing.Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to scaling the platform.Tackle challenging technical problems and continuously improve the product.Drive scalability and performance improvements across the platform.Lead by initiative: proactively research, experiment, and bring actionable ideas on how to improve the desired outcomes.Skills:2+ years of professional software engineering experience (can include internship experience).Strong fundamentals in computer science, including data structures, algorithms, design patterns, and web-based software architecture.Ability to work remotely with flexible hours, aligning with offshore teams.Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with .NET Core, AWS, and frontend technologies like React/Next.js is a strong plus.Familiarity with travel technologies like Sabre travel GDS/Webservices.Comfortable in a fast-paced environment.Pittsburgh-based candidates are preferred.Benefits:Competitive compensation package.Opportunity to work in a fast-growing, innovative startup environment.Flexible remote work policy with occasional face-to-face meetings.Fast growth potential based on performance.Sponsorship for work visas if required.How to Apply:Please send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience to support@travelwits.com.
Requirements: As a startup with product-market fit, we're in a crucial phase of scaling our platform to meet increasing demand. We're seeking a talented and driven Software Engineer who will play a pivotal role in enhancing our product's scalability and performance. In addition to taking ownership of significant projects, you'll also be involved in code reviews, and high-level software design decisions. The ideal candidate is someone passionate about continuous learning and continuous improvement, with a sharp mind, quick learning abilities, and a strong grasp of software fundamentals. If you're eager to tackle challenges, help others grow, and drive scalable systems forward, we'd love to have you on our team., Collaborate closely with the lead engineer to understand the product architecture and deliver features effectively. Take ownership of software architecture, design strategies, and coding standards. Review code to ensure quality standards and contribute to testing. Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to scaling the platform. Tackle challenging technical problems and continuously improve the product. Drive scalability and performance improvements across the platform. Lead by initiative: proactively research, experiment, and bring actionable ideas on how to improve the desired outcomes., 2+ years of professional software engineering experience (can include internship experience). Strong fundamentals in computer science, including data structures, algorithms, design patterns, and web-based software architecture. Ability to work remotely with flexible hours, aligning with offshore teams. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset., Experience with .NET Core, AWS, and frontend technologies like React/Next.js is a strong plus. Familiarity with travel technologies like Sabre travel GDS/Webservices. Comfortable in a fast-paced environment. Pittsburgh-based candidates are preferred.

description: As a valued member of the main development team your primary duties will involve analysis, design, and implementation of web applications. An ideal candidate is comfortable with web programming, having previous experience with client-side markup and scripting languages, including HTML, JavaScript, and CSS; server-side web programming languages such as PHP, .NET, Node.js, or ColdFusion, and relational databases such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, or Oracle. Candidates will require an understanding of the Client-Server model (as is standard for web applications,) client-side scripting, database design & usage, and web design are all desirable. If you do not have all these skills but are a good programmer looking for a great learning experience, you may be a great fit for our team as well. description: Don't want to work for a company that just makes rich people richer? Care about mental health and gender equality? You're not alone. We're mission driven because we don't really see how you couldn't be by this point. If this resonates with you, contact us by August 15th.YouAs a developer, your primary role will be assisting with our newest feature: Coursicle Chat. Coursicle Chat allows students to connect with others in their classes, major, and dorm. We hope to establish Coursicle Chat as the college "academic network", instilling a sense of community in classes that doesn't exist today. It's all too common to find yourself feeling alone in a class, despite being surrounded by dozens or even hundreds of other people. We're confident that reducing that isolation will have a very positive impact on students' mental health. For every class, for every major, there will finally be a place to go when you need help with an assignment, advice on what classes to take, or people to study with.We don't care about what languages you know or frameworks you have experience in. Our philosophy has always been to hire great people and teach them what they need to know (footnote 1). And although development is the role's focus, since we're a very small team you'll have the opportunity to learn about other aspects of the business as well (software, business, marketing, etc.).UsCompany:600,000 usersRunning entirely on revenueSmall team (4 full-time, 1 part-time)Role:1% equity stake (4 year vest)$60,000 - $80,000 salary range (footnote 2)Unlimited paid time off401(k) with up to 4% cash matchMissions:Mental health: we've seen first-hand the stigma we hold toward mental illness (read our CEO's essay about his struggle with anxiety and depression). Protecting members of a community from bad actors is critical to its well-being. Unlike every existing platform, Coursicle Chat requires a .edu email to use, which allows us to significantly reduce hate, harassment, and spam (since these bad actors can't create a new account when they get banned).Gender equity: we want equal representation of minorities and gender identities in all managerial and engineering roles. We know it's important we start on this early because it's not easily corrected, and we think it's fitting that we be the ones to do it given Coursicle was founded by someone non-binary and a woman.Wealth disparity: we don't want to make the rich richer, so we don't take investment, we don't optimize for profit, and every employee at Coursicle makes the same salary (footnote 2). We want to show the world that money can't continue to be the end goal anymore and you can be successful without trying to squeeze every cent out of people.Footnotes: In case you want to see our tech stack anyway, here you go.Every employee at Coursicle makes the same base salary of $60,000 and company profits are split equally as bonuses. In recent years, these bonuses have been $15,000 - $20,000.

description: We are seeking a Full-Stack Developer to lead the technical development of Synapse, a social media platform focused on expert-led discussions. You will be responsible for driving both mobile and web development, ensuring scalability and efficiency as we grow. While our current tech stack includes React Native (mobile), ReactJS (web), Flask/Python (back-end), and AWS infrastructure, we are open to evolving and improving our technology choices. You’ll work closely with tour team to refine our MVP and help shape the future technical direction of the platform. The ideal candidate is adaptable, passionate about building scalable systems, and aligned with our mission of fostering intellectual discourse. we’re seeking someone ready to take on a leadership position, build a solid technical team around them, manage budgets, and drive our technological vision forward.

description: Applications SpecialistComputer Packages Inc, a global company specializing in Intellectual Property software is seeking an Applications Specialist to work at our Rockville, MD location. You will manage and support existing business applications while analyzing and implementing new applications. Bachelor's degree and/or at least three years experience required. Experience with accounting and CRM applications as well as knowledge of database concepts and some programming background a plus. Recent or upcoming grads are encouraged to apply. Starting salary: $60,000 - $80,000 annually, commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits including tuition reimbursement, fully paid health insurance, 401k, relocation assistance and visa sponsorship. Strong opportunity for growth. Please send resume to: cpijobs@computerpackages.com

job_title: NetApp Emerging Talent - Entry Level Software Engineer
description: Job Summary We are seeking candidates for an entry-level Software Engineering position. This role is designed for individuals who are at the beginning of their career journey and may have limited professional experience in the field. We welcome recent graduates or those with basic knowledge and a strong desire to learn and grow in this role. As a Software Engineer you would participate in product design, development, verification, troubleshooting, and delivery of a system or major subsystems. This position requires an individual to be creative, team-oriented, technology savvy, driven to produce results and demonstrates the ability to take a cross-team leadership role.    We invest heavily in new talent. Your energy and fresh ideas are vital to cementing our position as a market -leader. We’ll push you beyond your comfort zone with a belief that no idea is off-limits. At the same time, you’ll have all the resources, mentoring and feedback you need to grow. What’s more, whatever your role, you can be yourself in a team that celebrates individuality and welcomes different perspectives.  Job Requirements Some areas of scope within our Software Engineering organization are (but not limited to)-    Front End Development: Design and implement code using Functional and Object-Oriented JavaScript, HTMP, CSS    Develop enterprise SaaS software using modular, reusable JS components and data visualizations    Understanding of concepts related to computer architecture, data structures and algorithms and design patterns/practices    Back End Development:  Understanding of C/C++, Java, and or Python    Participate in product design, development, verification, troubleshooting, and delivery of a system or major subsystems    Projects, experiences, or coursework related to areas such as: Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Multi-Threading, Data Structures & Algorithms     Additional Details: Job Posting Info: This is a pipeline position that will be opened on a recurring basis and used to fill roles aligned with the required skill sets. Program Dates: This is full-time role with a flexible start date in 2025. Recruiting efforts will be ongoing until specific teams find an ideal match. Thrive Together: NetApp’s approach to in-person and remote work will be a flexible hybrid model that emphasizes flexibility for employees and puts our talent first. Education & Experience Typically requires a Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent experience and 0-2 years related experience. CompensationThe base salary range for this position is $107,000 - $150,000 and will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off (PTO), various Leave options, Performance-Based Incentives, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s), with all offerings subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. Benefits may vary by country and region, and further details will be provided as part of the recruitment process. Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know...Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.
Requirements: Some areas of scope within our Software Engineering organization are (but not limited to)-, Typically requires a Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent experience and 0-2 years related experience.

description: Seed Oil Scout (SOS) is a rapidly growing tech company in the food and dining space. Our iOS app, ranking in the top 50 globally in Food & Drink, is dedicated to bringing transparency to restaurant sourcing and ingredients. With over 1M downloads and 300K Instagram followers, including high-profile celebrities, we're changing American dining for the better.Our founder is an MIT grad and was tech lead at Google for nearly a decade, you'll be learning from the best.SOS is a unique tech company in that it's grown past 1M users with no employees, getting incredible leverage out of AI code generation and content creation. SOS has achieved incredible marketing success through novel AI-backed techniques, such as the hit country single, 1950's magazine spread, and powerful AI narration, wowing millions of viewers for pennies compared to larger competitors.The RoleWe're seeking a talented and motivated Full-Stack software engineer to join our innovative team. This role is perfect for a new graduate or senior in college looking to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, AI-driven startup environment. Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain high-quality Flutter code for iOS and Android applications.Work on API integrations with Node.js to power features such as payments (Stripe), user analytics (Amplitude), and subscription management (RevenueCat).Collaborate with the product and data teams to ensure effective implementation of analytics platforms.Build robust data pipelines to streamline the collection and analysis of user and app performance data.Create and maintain scalable and maintainable backend services that enhance app performance and reliability.Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability.Technologies We UseFlutter for cross-platform mobile developmentNode.js for API and backend servicesStripe for payment processingAmplitude description: GibsonAI is an AI platform for building backend software. GibsonAI's output is reliable and can be shipped to production without concern for hallucinations, non-existent libraries or bugs. To achieve this we have to be very conscious of the state-of-the-art in generative AI and apply various machine learning techniques and algorithms alongside a large language model.GibsonAI also aims to help development teams make sense of the AI landscape by abstracting LLM details, what works and what does not, behind a suite of tools that are easy to use, meet the developer where they love to code and work, every time. Our main customer is a developer and they love working with our tools.As the AI landscape continues to evolve, GibsonAI will determine which is the best LLM for a particular task, when we rely on generative AI versus proprietary models and algorithms and how best to implement AI assisted tools to significantly increase the speed and accuracy of the developer.We are backed by top VCs and our team has extensive experience for this endeavor (Ex Microsoft, Lyft, Apple). GibsonAI is a significant innovation over what exists today and we are working fast to be the best in the space. RequirementsMinimum undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline2+ years experience hands on codingExperience building AI agents and RAG applicationsFamiliarity with open source LLMs (Llama, Mistral etc)Good understanding of RDBMS systems, database design & vector databasesFamiliarity with AI coding tools & a desire to build better AI driven dev tools Bonus: Deploying open source LLMs & fine tuningTechnical SkillsPython & SQLLarge language models (LLM)Langchain or other agent frameworksOpen source LLMs and agents
Requirements: Minimum undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline 2+ years experience hands on coding Experience building AI agents and RAG applications Familiarity with open source LLMs (Llama, Mistral etc) Good understanding of RDBMS systems, database design & vector databases Familiarity with AI coding tools & a desire to build better AI driven dev tools Bonus: Deploying open source LLMs & fine tuning, Python & SQL Large language models (LLM) Langchain or other agent frameworks Open source LLMs and agents

description: Software Engineer - R24-050Verite Group offers 100% paid Benefits, 15% Employer Contribution to 401K, Stock Options, Flex-Time, Year End Bonuses, Paid Overtime and many more Amazing first-class benefits.VGI is a 100% employee-owned custom software company supporting government missions and private sector enterprises for over two decades. VGI staff combine a strong technical prowess with a deep understanding of our customers and their operations. VGI can take your current network needs and challenges and create tools that protect your data throughout its lifecycle.JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Verite Group, Inc. is actively recruiting top tier software engineering talent to join our development team. Verite Group, Inc. is both a software product development company and a consultancy.Developers for this position will be active in all phases of software development: design, implementation, testing, deployment, and support. In this position, you will work within small teams to develop and deploy mission-critical systems, reverse-engineer network application protocols, and develop tools for complex data and network analysis. Applications developed will vary from stand-alone scripts to complex, multi-threaded client / server architectures.Successful candidates will be strong engineers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. The VG development team requires creative engineering balanced with high quality and customer focus. You will have the ability to work in an entrepreneurial environment and be able to contribute to a high-energy team.REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Security Clearance: Clearable to Top Secret ClearanceA Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or a related field.Experience writing and debugging multi-threaded applications.Strong understanding of the TCP/IP stack and network protocols, especially as concerns communication of applications on the Internet.Familiarity with running/operating/debugging in a Linux environment.DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Experience with reverse engineering applications, with Java reverse engineering being the most desirable.C/C++/assembly programming experience.Experience with Mobile Application Development, with Android, programming being the most desirable, not required.WORK LOCATION: Dulles, VA (Washington D.C. Metro Area)TRAVEL: 0% VGI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

description: Position: Project Manager & Assistant to Founder (Web Generalist)Location: Work from homeType: Full-TimeReports to: FounderAbout Us:Peak Digital is a feminist-lead team on a mission to improve government websites located in San Francisco, CA. We value our employees immensely and are committed to supporting everyone in living their purpose. We revolutionize government websites by making them intuitive, user-friendly, and accessible to all. Our projects include website development, browser applications, and data-heavy websites. We are committed to innovation, quality, and delivering impactful digital experiences.Job Summary:We are seeking a highly motivated, emotionally intelligent individual to assist our founder in managing client relationships and internal team coordination. This role involves attending client meetings, identifying action items, managing tasks in Asana, and ensuring projects stay on track. You will act as a liaison between the founder and the internal team, help maintain project momentum, and ensure that deliverables meet the highest standards.This is an excellent opportunity for someone just out of college who is pursuing a career in web or application development and is eager to learn. We are looking for someone who can adapt to our proven processes while bringing a strong understanding of web development, user experience, and information architecture.However, this is not a personal assistant position—there are no personal errands. This is a business assistant position where you may be working on budgets, proposals, or reports in support of the founder.Key Responsibilities:Attend client meetings with the founder, take notes, and identify action items.Create and manage Asana tickets for developers, writers, designers, and data specialists.Follow up on outstanding tasks, proactively addressing issues, and ensuring deadlines are met.Write meeting agendas for both internal and client meetings.Monitor and review tickets to identify blockers or issues.Collaborate with the team via Slack to keep communication and project flow smooth.Assist with scheduling and coordinating important meetings, ensuring everyone is prepared.Work closely with UX designers to ensure a high-quality user experience.Create sitemaps, user flows and content inventories when needed.Stay on top of security, accessibility (WCAG 2.2), and 508 compliance standards.Be self-motivated and capable of managing yourself without heavy supervision.Ensure stakeholders feel heard and meetings are well-organized, often leading these meetings.Act as a “web generalist,” contributing both on the client-facing side and product management side.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or recent graduate in a relevant field (web development, application development, or a related area).Strong emotional intelligence and the ability to "read the room" in client and team meetings.Excellent listening skills and the ability to ensure all voices are heard.Strong interest in web development, UX, and information architecture.Self-motivated and able to manage your workload and deadlines independently.Basic understanding of web technologies like Drupal, Tailwind, React.js, and design tools like Figma, and communications tools like Slack, Asana is a plus.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Strong understanding of web development best practices and standards.Excellent leadership and team management skills.Ability to manage many projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Familiarity with browser applications and data-heavy website development.Understanding of web standardsPreferred Qualifications:Understanding of accessibility standardsUnderstanding of Google Drive platform and toolsUnderstanding of Box platform and toolsEssential Skills:Project Management:Proficient with tools like Asana for tracking tasks and deadlines.Skilled in creating agendas, managing action items, and following up.Communication:Strong verbal and written communication.Emotional intelligence to manage client and team interactions effectively.Technical Understanding:Familiar with web development (Drupal, React.js, Tailwind) and UX principles.Knowledge of information architecture and accessibility standards (WCAG 2.2, 508 compliance).Problem Solving:Able to anticipate and address blockers or escalate issues.Self-Motivation:Highly organized and able to manage tasks independently.Proactive in ensuring project deadlines are met.Client Relationship Management:Build and maintain strong client relationships.Comfortable leading or assisting in client meetings.Team Collaboration:Work well with designers, developers, and other team members via tools like Slack.Adaptability:Willingness to learn and adapt to established processes.Leadership Potential:Confident in leading meetings and taking initiative.
Requirements: Attend client meetings with the founder, take notes, and identify action items. Create and manage Asana tickets for developers, writers, designers, and data specialists. Follow up on outstanding tasks, proactively addressing issues, and ensuring deadlines are met. Write meeting agendas for both internal and client meetings. Monitor and review tickets to identify blockers or issues. Collaborate with the team via Slack to keep communication and project flow smooth. Assist with scheduling and coordinating important meetings, ensuring everyone is prepared. Work closely with UX designers to ensure a high-quality user experience. Create sitemaps, user flows and content inventories when needed. Stay on top of security, accessibility (WCAG 2.2), and 508 compliance standards. Be self-motivated and capable of managing yourself without heavy supervision. Ensure stakeholders feel heard and meetings are well-organized, often leading these meetings. Act as a “web generalist,” contributing both on the client-facing side and product management side., Bachelor’s degree or recent graduate in a relevant field (web development, application development, or a related area). Strong emotional intelligence and the ability to "read the room" in client and team meetings. Excellent listening skills and the ability to ensure all voices are heard. Strong interest in web development, UX, and information architecture. Self-motivated and able to manage your workload and deadlines independently. Basic understanding of web technologies like Drupal, Tailwind, React.js, and design tools like Figma, and communications tools like Slack, Asana is a plus. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong understanding of web development best practices and standards. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Ability to manage many projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with browser applications and data-heavy website development. Understanding of web standards, Understanding of accessibility standards Understanding of Google Drive platform and tools Understanding of Box platform and tools,

description: Are you a web and graphic designer looking for a work environment where you can help make a positive difference? If so, then this opening might be the right one for you.CyberVillage Networkers, Inc. is a small, stable, and growing company that delivers value to our clients. We have a 'family' closeness yet we are a highly professional team of excellence. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to work closely with our client base, who truly love and appreciate the work we do for them. We are all about serving our clients and being there for them; not about maximizing profit. We are committed to providing a positive work environment where you can thrive, be productive, and valued.You will be responsible for the conceptual design, layout, content composition, end product layout/coding, and graphic designs for websites, social media, email marketing, and conventional marketing material.Candidates must have a solid work ethic and a professional demeanor. Time management skills are critical and expected. Candidates must have a positive attitude and be flexible. Ability to set and meet goals and deadlines is important. Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) are an extremely important element in this position.

description: About Us:Eden's venture-funded AI company based in New York City with the mission of creating the social interactive dimension of the internet. Founded by a dynamic team of Columbia undergrads, an MIT PhD, and a UCSD PhD, Eden AI's platform empowers users to leave a mark on the internet through our proprietary AI-powered technology. Users can create interest points, or "Marks," that form a web of interconnected nodes, linking people with shared interests from across the web. This new approach fosters deeper connections and conversations, transforming the way users engage with the internet by seamlessly connecting through these dynamic points of interest.Eden's core products have received high reviews from Google Chrome Store and has received the coveted "Featured" badge. We are committed to enhancing how social data is used and valued across the digital landscape. With thousands of active users, we are funded by prominent venture funds from the U.S. and Singapore.Responsibilities:Collaborate with UI/UX designers and engineers to develop and enhance the Eden AI platform, including our webapp and browser extension.Implement and maintain features that utilize our AI engine, ensuring a seamless integration that enhances user experience.Test and optimize the platform in fast iterations to maintain high performance and user satisfaction.Develop and manage a CI/CD pipeline for efficient deployment of the platform across various environments.Qualifications:Extensive experience in building, testing, and deploying web applications; and designing REST APIs.Expertise in HTML, CSS, Next.js v14.x, TypeScript, and Node.js.Proficiency with React.js, Tailwind CSS, Webpack for developing browser extensions.Experience with serverless architecture, including Supabase and PostgreSQL.Familiarity with Docker and deployment on cloud platforms such as Vercel.Good to haves:Experience with AI technologies, particularly integrating and optimizing AI functionalities within web applications.Background in database optimization and caching techniques (e.g., Memcache, Redis) to enhance application scalability.
Requirements: Collaborate with UI/UX designers and engineers to develop and enhance the Eden AI platform, including our webapp and browser extension. Implement and maintain features that utilize our AI engine, ensuring a seamless integration that enhances user experience. Test and optimize the platform in fast iterations to maintain high performance and user satisfaction. Develop and manage a CI/CD pipeline for efficient deployment of the platform across various environments., Extensive experience in building, testing, and deploying web applications; and designing REST APIs. Expertise in HTML, CSS, Next.js v14.x, TypeScript, and Node.js. Proficiency with React.js, Tailwind CSS, Webpack for developing browser extensions. Experience with serverless architecture, including Supabase and PostgreSQL. Familiarity with Docker and deployment on cloud platforms such as Vercel.

With thousands of active users, we are funded by prominent venture funds from the U.S. and Singapore.Responsibilities:Collaborate with UI/UX designers and engineers to develop and enhance the Eden AI platform, including our webapp and browser extension.Implement and maintain features that utilize our AI engine, ensuring a seamless integration that enhances user experience.Test and optimize the platform in fast iterations to maintain high performance and user satisfaction.Develop and manage a CI/CD pipeline for efficient deployment of the platform across various environments.Qualifications:Extensive experience in building, testing, and deploying web applications; and designing REST APIs.Expertise in HTML, CSS, Next.js v14.x, TypeScript, and Node.js.Proficiency with React.js, Tailwind CSS, Webpack for developing browser extensions.Experience with serverless architecture, including Supabase and PostgreSQL.Familiarity with Docker and deployment on cloud platforms such as Vercel.Good to haves:Experience with AI technologies, particularly integrating and optimizing AI functionalities within web applications.Background in database optimization and caching techniques (e.g., Memcache, Redis) to enhance application scalability.
skills: Not Specified
technical_skills: Docker, CI/CD, React, Node.js, REST APIs, PostgreSQL, Redis

description: Job Summary:Resilience, Inc. is a nonprofit organization that is dedicated to improving the mental health of students, as well as reducing mass shootings, suicide, and depression. Resilience, Inc also works to combat declining test scores, low student engagement, and a slew of other social issues. Our organization focuses on offering Social Emotional Learning tools to enable K-12 schools to teach emotional intelligence through five core topics; self-awareness, self-control, social awareness, relationship management, goal setting, and effective decision-making. Resilience, Inc. also provides tools for acquiring and maintaining inspiration, hope, and overall well-being. Our mission is to teach SEL at every school in the country. It is a tough challenge, but we know “No Challenge, No Change.” If you are also concerned about children’s mental health and social being, join us! Become a member of Resilience, Inc, and help change the way schools approach mental health. Resilience offers unpaid internship programs that require at least a 4 month commitment with a minimum of 5 hours per week. There are flexible start and end dates with the option to continue after meeting the minimum requirement Although this is an unpaid internship, there is the opportunity to earn school credit. Some educational institutions require prior approval before the start of an internship. It is the responsibility of the student to check with their institution to be sure they meet any requirements before they accept a position. A Frontend Developer is responsible for creating and implementing the visual elements of a website or web application, ensuring a seamless and visually appealing user experience. This role involves translating design mockups into responsive and interactive user interfaces using programming languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Frontend Developers collaborate closely with UX/UI designers and backend developers to integrate frontend components with server-side logic. They are also responsible for optimizing web applications for performance and ensuring cross-browser compatibility. This role requires a combination of creativity, technical skill, and a focus on user-centric design to enhance the overall frontend experience. Responsibilities and Activities:Web Development:Work closely with senior developers to implement responsive and visually appealing user interfaces.Write and maintain clean, well-documented, and efficient code in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Assist in the development and integration of frontend components.Design Collaboration:Collaborate with UI/UX designers to understand design requirements and contribute to the implementation of design concepts.Ensure the translation of design wireframes and mockups into functional web pages.Coding and Debugging:Identify and fix bugs, troubleshoot issues, and optimize code for performance.Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality standards.Responsive Design:Implement responsive design principles to ensure a consistent user experience across various devices and screen sizes.Test and optimize web applications for different browsers to ensure cross-browser compatibility.Frameworks and Libraries:Gain hands-on experience with popular frontend frameworks and libraries (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue.js).Assist in the implementation of frontend features using the chosen framework.Testing:Conduct thorough testing of web applications to identify and address any issues.Collaborate with the testing team to create and execute testing plans.Documentation:Maintain detailed and up-to-date documentation for all frontend code and processes.Document coding best practices and guidelines.Learning and Skill Development:Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and technologies in frontend development.Seek opportunities to expand your skill set and contribute innovative ideas to projects.Team Collaboration:Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including backend developers, to ensure seamless integration of frontend and backend components.Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for continuous improvement.Project Management:Assist in project planning, task estimation, and progress tracking.Communicate regularly with team members to ensure project milestones are met.Creative Input:Participate in brainstorming sessions and provide creative input to enhance the overall user experience.Continuous Improvement:1Actively seek feedback and use it to improve your skills and performance.Contribute ideas for process improvement and optimization.Requirements:Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field.Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and popular frontend frameworks/libraries (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue.js).Familiarity with responsive design principles.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.Note: This internship offers a unique chance to be part of a meaningful project that positively impacts the lives of refugees. While the position is unpaid, it provides valuable experience in project management, social impact initiatives, and collaboration with diverse teams. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a noble cause and enhance your skills in a real-world setting.

description: About Us:We’re a team of early WeChat and Facebook veterans, reinventing messaging apps with built-in AI agents. Our AI agents interact seamlessly with users, enhancing conversations with both fun and utility. We believe in an open future for AI, enabling everyone to use the technology in diverse and innovative ways through open source. We’re seeking an Android Engineer to join our team and help revolutionize the future of messaging. With us you'll enjoy a collaborative culture, cozy office in the center of Palo Alto, and the opportunity to make a big impact. Compensation:Highly competitive, commensurate with experience and skill level. Includes benefits, and equity options. Key Responsibilities:Technical: Contribute to the development of our Android application, focusing on efficiency and user experience.Code Quality: Write and maintain clean, readable Kotlin and Java code.Collaboration: Work with product, design, and engineering teams to implement new features and improvements.Learning: Keep up-to-date with Android development trends and apply new technologies when appropriate.Team Support: Participate in code reviews and assist junior developers when needed.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.1-3 years of professional Android (or other area if willing to learn Android) development experience.Experience in developing and maintaining mobile applications.Preferred Qualifications:Familiarity with chat or messaging applications.Interest in or contributions to open-source Android projects.Knowledge of Android best practices and design patterns. What We Offer:Competitive Compensation: Beyond a competitive salary, we offer bonuses, benefits, and stock options.Growth: A challenging and rewarding work environment that values personal and professional growth.Innovation: Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge product that’s reshaping the world of communication.Team: Join a passionate team that values transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.If you're an innovative Android Engineer eager to make a real impact in the world of communication, we'd love to meet you. Apply by sending your resume, a link to your GitHub or portfolio, and a brief cover letter to jobs@channel.surf
Requirements: Technical: Contribute to the development of our Android application, focusing on efficiency and user experience. Code Quality: Write and maintain clean, readable Kotlin and Java code. Collaboration: Work with product, design, and engineering teams to implement new features and improvements. Learning: Keep up-to-date with Android development trends and apply new technologies when appropriate. Team Support: Participate in code reviews and assist junior developers when needed., Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent practical experience. 1-3 years of professional Android (or other area if willing to learn Android) development experience. Experience in developing and maintaining mobile applications., Familiarity with chat or messaging applications. Interest in or contributions to open-source Android projects. Knowledge of Android best practices and design patterns.

description: Job descriptionWe are looking for a highly skilled computer programmer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming. Full stack developers are responsible for developing and designing front end web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of applications, and working alongside graphic designers for web design features, among other duties.Full stack developers will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.Full Stack Developer Responsibilities:Developing front end website architecture.Designing user interactions on web pages.Developing back-end website applications.Creating servers and databases for functionality.Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.Ensuring responsiveness of applications.Working alongside graphic designers for web design features.Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.Designing and developing APIs.Meeting both technical and consumer needs.Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.Full Stack Developer Requirements:Degree in computer science.Strong organizational and project management skills.Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React, and Amber.Proficiency with server-side languages such as Python, Ruby, Java, PHP, and .Net.Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, and MongoDB.Excellent verbal communication skills.Good problem-solving skills.Attention to detail.
Requirements: Developing front end website architecture. Designing user interactions on web pages. Developing back-end website applications. Creating servers and databases for functionality. Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones. Ensuring responsiveness of applications. Working alongside graphic designers for web design features. Seeing through a project from conception to finished product. Designing and developing APIs. Meeting both technical and consumer needs. Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages., Degree in computer science. Strong organizational and project management skills. Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React, and Amber. Proficiency with server-side languages such as Python, Ruby, Java, PHP, and .Net. Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, and MongoDB. Excellent verbal communication skills. Good problem-solving skills. Attention to detail.

description: Data-Core Systems, Inc. is a provider of information technology, consulting and business process services. We offer breakthrough tech solutions and have worked with companies, hospitals, universities and government organizations. A proven partner with a passion for client satisfaction, we combine technology innovation, business process expertise and a global, collaborative workforce that exemplifies the future of work. For more information about Data-Core Systems, Inc., please visit https://datacoresystems.com/.Data-Core Systems Inc. is seeking a Junior DevOps Engineer to be a part of our Consulting team. You will participate and effectively contribute to the design, development, and training of both IT and business professionals. You’ll provide managerial support for individual initiatives. You will have the opportunity to work with other SME consultants from our existing team.Responsibilities:Optimize Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE solutions.Use Terraform for cloud infrastructure management.Create shell scripts for automation.Implement CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps and Jenkins.Manage Azure resources for performance and security.Implement Entra ID for access management.Collaborate with teams to improve processes.Set up monitoring and provide performance reports.Qualifications and Nice to haves:Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field.2-5 years of DevOps experience, especially with D365 CE.Expertise in Terraform and Azure DevOps.Strong scripting skills.Familiarity with Azure services and cloud security.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Experience with container orchestration and Agile methodologies is preferred.We are an equal opportunity employer.
Requirements: Optimize Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE solutions. Use Terraform for cloud infrastructure management. Create shell scripts for automation. Implement CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps and Jenkins. Manage Azure resources for performance and security. Implement Entra ID for access management. Collaborate with teams to improve processes. Set up monitoring and provide performance reports., Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field. 2-5 years of DevOps experience, especially with D365 CE. Expertise in Terraform and Azure DevOps. Strong scripting skills. Familiarity with Azure services and cloud security. Excellent problem-solving and communication skills. Experience with container orchestration and Agile methodologies is preferred. We are an equal opportunity employer.

You will have the opportunity to work with other SME consultants from our existing team.Responsibilities:Optimize Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE solutions.Use Terraform for cloud infrastructure management.Create shell scripts for automation.Implement CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps and Jenkins.Manage Azure resources for performance and security.Implement Entra ID for access management.Collaborate with teams to improve processes.Set up monitoring and provide performance reports.Qualifications  and Nice to haves:Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field.2-5 years of DevOps experience, especially with D365 CE.Expertise in Terraform and Azure DevOps.Strong scripting skills.Familiarity with Azure services and cloud security.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Experience with container orchestration and Agile methodologies is preferred.We are an equal opportunity employer.

description: We are looking for a data scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information and find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights.In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine learning and research.Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.ResponsibilitiesIdentify valuable data sources and automate collection processesUndertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured dataAnalyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patternsBuild predictive models and machine-learning algorithmsCombine models through ensemble modelingPresent information using data visualization techniquesPropose solutions and strategies to business challengesCollaborate with engineering and product development teamsRequirements and skillsProven experience as a Data Scientist or Data AnalystExperience in data miningUnderstanding of machine learning and operations researchKnowledge of R, SQL, and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an assetExperience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)Analytical mind and business acumenStrong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)Problem-solving aptitudeExcellent communication and presentation skillsBSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field; graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred

description: Who is HCLTech?We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 222,000+ people across 60 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be. If all this sounds like an environment you’ll thrive in, then you’re in the right place. Join us on our journey in advancing the technological world through innovation and creativity.What is the Global Engagement Management (GEM) Program?The GEM program is an early-career program in the area of business management at HCLTech for current students from selected colleges and universities across the country. This internship will challenge and develop your business acumen and leadership while working with a seasoned business mentor. Upon completion of the internship, you will have completed a business project in account management, bid management, competitor segment analysis or service/product strategy. This will give you an insight into a business management career with HCLTech and may lead to an opportunity to join our company full-time, upon graduation.When will the GEM internship take place?February 2025 to April 2025 [12 weeks], part-time for 20 hours/week [flexible with course schedule]Is this a paid internship?Absolutely. Competitive pay is a no-brainer for us! Our hourly rates are as follows: Graduate Interns: $40/hourUndergraduate Interns: $32/hourWhat are we looking for?Apply for the GEM Program if you are interested in starting your business management career with HCLTech. Eligibility requirements include: Undergraduate or graduate student studying business administrationCumulative GPA of a 3.0 or higherHave the legal right to work in the United States What will give you an edge?Customer service or client management experienceLeadership skills developed through previous work and/on-campus or community involvementExcellent communication and presentation skills; detail-oriented and organizedTakes initiative to solve problems prior to asking for guidance/supportPassion and focus on providing high-quality workFlexible in adapting to changeWhat will the work environment be?The GEM Internship is fully virtual. EEO EmployerHCL is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law. Should any applicant have concerns about discrimination in the hiring process, they should provide a detailed report of those concerns to secure@hcltech.com for investigation.Reasonable AccommodationsAt HCLTech, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive application and selection process. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to job applicants who may require provisions to participate in the recruitment and selection process. Should you require an accommodation, please select this option on your application, and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.
Requirements: Apply for the GEM Program if you are interested in starting your business management career with HCLTech. Eligibility requirements include: Undergraduate or graduate student studying business administration Cumulative GPA of a 3.0 or higher Have the legal right to work in the United States

description: About the jobAbout the Job:We're looking for a candidate who is Well-versed with concepts and techniques of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing Job Responsibilities:1) Must be able to do end-to-end Design, Develop and implement sophisticated Power BI solutions which include ETL, Data models, interactive dashboards/visualizations/Reports that effectively communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) and insights.2) Advanced in Data aggregation techniques to consolidate and summarize data from multiple sources.3) Able to guide the team on all best practices related to Power BI service, including Data Modeling, dashboard/Report Design, writing complex DAX formulas, Power Query, the PBI Tenant (service/server based), external BPI tools & have a general understanding of the Azure stack.4) Familiar with Visual Studio, Power BI Service, Fabric with Git integration for CI/CD pipelines, on-premises gateway, etc5) Hands-on experience in SQL/PostgreSQL skills for data manipulation, ad-hoc Queries, and Star Schema design.6) Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvement or business growth.7) Optimize data models and queries for performance and efficiency, ensuring fast and accurate data retrieval.8) Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability through data profiling, cleansing, and transformation.9) Stay tuned with the latest Power BI features, techniques, and best practices to continuously enhance the BI environment.10) Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide training, support, and guidance on Power BI usage and best practices.11) Excellent problem-solving skills, highly motivated, is a quick learner, and has attention to details12) Preferred programming languages include Python/R for data manipulation and advanced analytics.
Requirements: 1) Must be able to do end-to-end Design, Develop and implement sophisticated Power BI solutions which include ETL, Data models, interactive dashboards/visualizations/Reports that effectively communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) and insights. 2) Advanced in Data aggregation techniques to consolidate and summarize data from multiple sources.

description: 1. Programming & Software DevelopmentLanguages: Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or C++.Frameworks/Tools: Knowledge of frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn for machine learning.APIs: Understanding how to use APIs to pull data and integrate external services.2. Data Science & Machine LearningData Processing: Ability to collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets (e.g., user interactions, engagement patterns).Algorithms: Familiarity with recommendation systems, clustering, and classification algorithms.Modeling: Experience in building models that predict or suggest content based on user behavior.NLP (Natural Language Processing): For handling user-generated content like comments, posts, and tags.3. Mathematics & StatisticsStatistics: Knowledge of statistical techniques for analyzing user data (e.g., probability, regression analysis).Optimization: Understanding optimization algorithms (e.g., gradient descent) for improving models.4. Database ManagementSQL/NoSQL: Experience with relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases for storing user data.Big Data: Handling large-scale data storage solutions like Hadoop, Spark, or cloud-based databases (AWS, Google Cloud).5. User Behavior & AnalyticsBehavioral Analysis: Understanding how to analyze user behavior, engagement metrics, and how to tailor content to user preferences.A/B Testing: Running tests to evaluate how different algorithm changes affect user engagement.6. Backend Development & ScalabilityScalability: Ensuring that the algorithm can scale with millions or billions of users.Distributed Systems: Knowledge of how to design and maintain distributed systems (e.g., microservices architecture).7. Ethics & Bias MitigationBias Detection: Understanding potential biases in the data and ensuring that the algorithm doesn’t amplify harmful or discriminatory behaviors.Privacy: Adhering to privacy laws like GDPR or CCPA when handling user data.8. DevOps & Cloud EngineeringCI/CD Pipelines: Building continuous integration and deployment pipelines for maintaining and updating the algorithm.Cloud Services: Using cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud) to deploy and manage algorithms.9. Product Sense & UX/UI ConsiderationsUser-Centric Design: Understanding the user’s needs and how the algorithm affects the user experience.Personalization: Creating systems that personalize feeds, timelines, or suggestions based on user preferences.

description: Location: Hybrid, Sunnyvale, California (3 days a week in the office)Onwards Together! Illumio, the pioneer and market leader of Zero Trust segmentation, prevents breaches from becoming cyber disasters. Illumio protects critical applications and valuable digital assets with proven segmentation technology purpose-built for the Zero Trust security model. Illumio ransomware mitigation and segmentation solutions see risk, isolate attacks, and secure data across cloud-native apps, hybrid and multi-clouds, data centers, and endpoints, enabling the world’s leading organizations to strengthen their cyber resiliency and reduce risk. Illuminate the future with Illumio and join a team that’s passionate about developing cutting-edge security solutions that protect the world's most critical assets. Our Team's VisionOur Engineering team is driven by a culture that thrives on visionary leadership, autonomy, and ownership, creating a dynamic synergy that drives us forward in the ever-evolving landscape of cybersecurity. When you join our team, you become part of the leader in Zero Trust Segmentation. You'll work with a cutting-edge technology stack that spans operating systems, distributed applications, and immersive UI/visualization tools. We're shaping the future of cybersecurity. And together, we will continue to build world-class products—led by people with different perspectives, backgrounds, and a commitment to innovation in a time when the world faces its greatest cybersecurity threats in history. Your Impact:You will design your service, develop features after solidifying the design with peer review process with take it to production qualityYou will primarily write code in Java, PythonWorking knowledge of Kubernetes orchestration or willing to learnOwn critical features and subsystems and own the entire software development lifecycle, from clarifying requirements to ensuring their successful deployment and usage by customersOwning service / feature operational aspects with necessary telemetry and metrics for identifying production issue quicklyOwn code quality, as we do early developer testing and functional/integration testing to ensure we build robust and resilient productsWilling to partner with Product management for requirements clarification, scoping and lockingYour Toolkit:Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent degree. Master’s degree is preferred3+ years building distributed & scalable software and systemsPassion for software development, willing to constantly learn, keeping up with technological trends, and working in a team settingAWS / Azure / GCP cloud experience: Extensively used one of these platforms at the API/programming levelExperience with networking and security controls is a plusLanguage requirementsExperience in one or more programming languages: Java, PythonREST API client experienceCloudFormation, Terraform are nice to haveWorking knowledge of spring or similar eco systemsKnowledge of Kubernetes and docker containers is good to haveGang of four design pattersCompensation:$135,000 - $155,000 USDThe pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include responsibilities of the job, education, location, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, and internal equity, alignment with market data, or applicable laws. At Illumio we offer a wide range of benefits to our eligible team members. Our benefit programs vary by location and can include Medical, Dental, Vision Coverage – Health and Dependent Savings Accounts – Life and Disability Programs – Paid Parental Leave – Voluntary Benefit Programs – Company Sponsored Wellness Program – Wellness Reimbursement Program - Retirement Savings – Equity Opportunities – Paid time off and Paid Holidays – Employee Incentive Program. Our Commitment: Illumio believes that an environment of unique backgrounds, experiences, viewpoints, and individual contributions drives our success and makes us stronger together. We are dedicated to creating and maintaining a diverse culture and emphasizing inclusion and belonging.

description: Blueera Technologies is seeking a DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the infrastructure and deployment pipelines for our cloud-based applications.Responsibilities :Develop and execute CI/CD pipelines using established tools and frameworks for application building, testing, and deployment.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, prioritize tasks, and contribute to project completion.Assist in overseeing infrastructure, including monitoring, basic management tasks, and optimization efforts to ensure optimal performance, security, and scalability.Assist in addressing and troubleshooting issues related to application development, deployment, and operational functions. Support efforts to streamline infrastructure provisioning, configuration, and orchestration through automation tools like Cloud-formation or Terraform. Contribute to ongoing enhancements to processes and tools to improve operational efficiency and productivity. Stay informed about emerging technologies and best practices within the fields of DevOps and cloud computing, and share relevant insights with the team.Requirements :2 - 4 years of practical experience in DevOps, with exposure to associated tools and technologies such as Jenkins, Docker, Terraform, and Container Orchestration Basic proficiency in configuring networks and deploying applications in cloud environments like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.Familiarity with at least one scripting language such as Bash, Python, or Power-shell, with a willingness to learn and grow in this area.Awareness of security best practices with a willingness to learn and implement relevant security measures under the guidance of senior team members.Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team environmentSkills:- Amazon Web Services (AWS), Windows Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

and network diagrams.Jira administration and workflow development.Research emerging technologies and industry trends to contribute to continuously improving IT processes and procedures.Participate in and Teams.Manage user and device accounts in the on-premise active directory and Microsoft Entra.Assist with hardware inventory management.Perform additional duties as assigned.Requirements:Enrolled in a degree program in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline.Basic knowledge of computer hardware, operating systems, and networking principles.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen interest in learning new technologies.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effective teamwork.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite development.Ability to prioritize and manage tasks efficiently in a dynamic, fast-paced setting.Motivated to gain practical experience and actively contribute to significant projects.*Only hiring All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.The hourly rate for this position is $15 per hour. Actual compensation will depend on a range of factors, including but not limited to the individual’s skills, experience, qualifications, certifications, location, other business and organizational needs, and applicable employment laws. Requirements: Provide technical support to end-users, including troubleshooting hardware and software issues and assisting with system configurations. Assist in setting up, installing, and maintaining computer systems, networks, and peripherals. Collaborate with IT team members on technology projects, such as software deployments, system upgrades, and network enhancements. Monitor and respond to helpdesk tickets and inquiries promptly, ensuring excellent customer service and resolution of issues. Assist in maintaining IT documentation, including user manuals, system configurations, and network diagrams. Jira administration and workflow development. Research emerging technologies and industry trends to contribute to continuously improving IT processes and procedures. Participate in IT meetings and training sessions to expand knowledge and skills in various technology areas. Perform basic administrative tasks in Microsoft 365 environments, such as Azure/Entra, InTune, SharePoint, and Teams. Manage user and device accounts in the on-premise active directory and Microsoft Entra. Assist with hardware inventory management. Perform additional duties as assigned., Enrolled in a degree program in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline. Basic knowledge of computer hardware, operating systems, and networking principles. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen interest in learning new technologies. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effective teamwork. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and basic troubleshooting skills. Previous experience with computer hardware assembly, software installation, and system configuration is advantageous. Familiarity with Jira Administration and workflow development. Ability to prioritize and manage tasks efficiently in a dynamic, fast-paced setting. Motivated to gain practical experience and actively contribute to significant projects.

description: Role DescriptionThis is an internship role for a Full Stack Engineer at Lica World. As a full-stack engineer, you will work on building and scaling core parts of our video generation technology. Work with the ML teams to productionize and build an experience around the large foundational models. Build features for the platform for serving creators to fast-track their content production workflows. Perform API design and development in Python, using microservices, and caching.What you needPrevious experience of building end to end applications. We want to checkout what you have built and scaled.Strong experience in backend or frontend technologies for graphic/ animation design.Proficient in designing intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces, with a good eye for aesthetics and user experience trends.Somebody who asks a lot of questions, is confident not knowing everything and is more likely to ask for help and collaborate than go it alone.

Perform API design and development in Python, using microservices, and caching.
