job_title: Mobile Engineering Intern - iOS or Android
description: eBay Inc. (Nasdaq: EBAY) is a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We exist to enable economic opportunity for individuals, entrepreneurs, businesses and organizations of all sizes. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, California, eBay is one of the world's largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection. In 2022, eBay enabled nearly $74 billion of gross merchandise volume. For more information about the company and its global portfolio of online brands, visit www.ebayinc.com.***Please submit only ONE application for eBay. Duplicate applications from the same candidate will result in all applications for that candidate being automatically declined. ******Please ensure that the email address you are using to apply through RippleMatch is the SAME EMAIL ADDRESS that is attached to your pre-existing RippleMatch account. Utilizing a different email address or setting up a new account will create back end issues related to your application. Thank you.***We are the Selling Excellence and Trust team that helps to deliver engaging customer experiences for our sellers. We own Seller Experience domains (Seller Hub, MyeBay selling, Member Messaging, Feedback, and many more tools such as AI responses, Robust Content Management system. These experiences have Science, Database, Service, Web, iOS and Android engineers working collectively in an agile environment. We are looking for highly collaborative, smart, driven engineering interns for either our iOS or Android teams who can help us reshape the future of our mobile application. You'll be working with a world class team of engineers, designers, product managers, business partners and analysts in a fun environment building world-class customer experiences. We are looking for both Android and IOS Developers.For Android: • Experience designing, developing Android applications, with experience in both Kotlin and Java• Experience in unit testing and functional UI testing with JUnit / Espresso• Experience with Android Studio• Experience with modern clean architecture patterns such as MVVM• Experience in integration with backend APIs (REST/GraphQL), network debugging (e.g. Charles)• Working towards strong technical fundamentals, Object Oriented design, Data structures and algorithmsFor IOS:• Experience designing, building and releasing iOS applications using industry standard patterns, with good experience in both Swift and Swift UI.• Experience in unit testing and functional UI testing with XCTest / XCUITest.• Experience with Xcode• Experience with modern design patterns such as MVVM, VIPER, RIBS, etc.• Experience with patterns for achieving feature modularity.• Experience in integration with backend APIs (REST/GraphQL), network debugging (e.g. Charles)• Strong in technical fundamentals, Object Oriented design, Data structures and algorithms.• Experience working with services teams to design optimal mobile services contractsWhat you can expect from us:• A collaborative, informal, international, and playful work environment with self-organized, multi-disciplinary agile/lean teams.• Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person.• Work with technologies such as Compose and other Jetpack libraries, Coroutines, Flows etc. and move in a fast-evolving microservice's architecture.• Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences, and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more).Responsibilities:• Work with the Product Owner and scrum team to design, develop, test and deliver customer facing features.• Demonstrate experience in technical/product design and service interaction patterns.• Implement tests and responsible software development practices.• Getting into the details, investigating issues, writing code, performing code reviews, and prototyping new solutions.• Collaborating effectively with product, design, and engineering teams across multiple domains.What we are looking for in candidates:• Currently enrolled as a student in an accredited Bachelors, Masters or PhD degree program within the United States graduating December 2025 - Summer 2026• 0-3 Years of software design and development experience working on a team.• Understanding of Dependency Injection frameworks like Dagger, Hilt and Jetpack libraries such as LiveData, DataBinding, ViewModel, etc.• Experience working with services teams to design optimal mobile services contracts.• Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.• Experience with project tracking and reporting tools (e.g., Jira).• Experience with SwiftUI, Dependency Injection patterns etc.• Experience with reactive programming using Combine or RxSwift.eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

description: SummaryResilience, Inc., a non-profit organization, works to improve mental health, reduce mass shootings, suicide, depression, declining test scores, low student engagement, and a slew of other social issues. The organization focuses on offering Social Emotional Learning tools to enable K-12 schools to teach emotional intelligence through 5 core topics: self-awareness, self-control, social awareness, relationship management, goal setting & effective decision-making. Resilience also provides tools for acquiring and maintaining inspiration, hope, social beings, and overall well-being. Our mission is to set SEL tools at every school in the country. It is a tough challenge, but we know “No Challenge, No Change.” If you also concern about children’s mental health and social being. Join us! Be a member of Resilience, Inc. We are seeking a WordPress Developer responsible for both back-end and front-end development, including creating WordPress themes and plugins. This position requires a combination of programming skills (namely PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript) and aesthetics (understanding element arrangements on the screen, the color and font choices, and so on). Experience with the responsive and adaptive design is strongly preferred. Also, an understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development, and deployment is preferred. This internship is 4 months long. Responsibilities:Designing and implementing new features and functionalityEstablishing and guiding the website’s architectureEnsuring high-performance and availability, and managing all technical aspects of the CMSHelping formulate an effective, responsive design and turning it into a working theme and plugin. Skills and Qualifications:Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQueryExperience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applicationsExperience designing and developing responsive design websitesComfortable working with debugging tools like Firebug, Chrome inspector, etc.Ability to understand CSS changes and their ramifications to ensure consistent style across platforms and browsersAbility to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pagesKnowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML)Proficient understanding of code versioning tools {{such as Git, SVN, and Mercurial}}Strong understanding of PHP back-end developmentMust have HTML/CSS experience at minimum, WordPress experience/knowledge desired but not necessarily required Check with your school's Internship Coordinator BEFORE accepting the hiring offer to determine if this position satisfies the criteria for receiving academic credit.

description: As a research engineering intern at Lica World you will - Work on building foundational Multimodal models for Graphic Design. Work with MLEs to productionize and scale the models for serving them through Lica's platform.Collaborate with Data Labeling team for data generation and augmentation for these modelsGet a chance to publish your work in top ML conferences/ workshops What you need - Experience in working with large Transformer models such as GPT or Llama, fine tuning, RL or prompt engineering techniques in industry or academiaPast publications record in conferences such as CVPR, Neurips, ACL, EMNLP or similar venues is a plus

description: The Company: Empyrean Solutions specializes in Financial Risk and Performance Management solutions for banks and credit unions. Empyrean offers a comprehensive suite of software products to support balance sheet simulations for Asset-Liability management, financial planning and analysis, capital stress testing, and funds transfer pricing. We deliver a complete solution that empowers institutions to manage risk and build stable long-term earnings. The Team: The financial modelers, data analysts and product experts of the Professional Services team help financial institutions harness the full potential of Empyrean’s software solutions through consulting, implementation services and training. Responsibilities: · Support Empyrean's Financial Risk Management Solutions for Asset-Liability Management, Liquidity Stress Testing, Deposit Modeling, Capital Stress testing, and Funds Transfer Pricing solutions for financial institutions of all sizes· Train clients on functional and technical matters related to Empyrean’s products· Help develop financial models to help clients assess risk exposures and profitability· Interpret risk measurement reports and analyses for clients· Advise clients on best practices for Balance Sheet Management, Economic Value of Equity, Earnings at Risk, Stress Testing, Funds Transfer Pricing and Deposit Modeling· Act as a liaison between the product management team and the user community· Follow all applicable policies and controls· Ensure customer data and sensitive data is transmitted using approved channels· Maintain the integrity of the sensitive customer data in line with policies and controls Experience and Education: · Degree in finance or related discipline· Interest or experience in banking, financial risk management or financial technology· Understanding of a bank's balance sheet· Understanding of fixed income instruments· Understanding of accounting and financial statements· Advanced knowledge of Excel· Experience working with large datasets· Strong attention to detail and good planning and organization skills Preferred skills: · Progress toward a CFA, FRM or PRM certification· Understanding of interest rate derivatives· Bank internship experience · Knowledge of SQL or Python
Requirements: The Company: Empyrean Solutions specializes in Financial Risk and Performance Management solutions for banks and credit unions. Empyrean offers a comprehensive suite of software products to support balance sheet simulations for Asset-Liability management, financial planning and analysis, capital stress testing, and funds transfer pricing. We deliver a complete solution that empowers institutions to manage risk and build stable long-term earnings. The Team: The financial modelers, data analysts and product experts of the Professional Services team help financial institutions harness the full potential of Empyrean’s software solutions through consulting, implementation services and training. Responsibilities: · Support Empyrean's Financial Risk Management Solutions for Asset-Liability Management, Liquidity Stress Testing, Deposit Modeling, Capital Stress testing, and Funds Transfer Pricing solutions for financial institutions of all sizes· Train clients on functional and technical matters related to Empyrean’s products· Help develop financial models to help clients assess risk exposures and profitability· Interpret risk measurement reports and analyses for clients· Advise clients on best practices for Balance Sheet Management, Economic Value of Equity, Earnings at Risk, Stress Testing, Funds Transfer Pricing and Deposit Modeling· Act as a liaison between the product management team and the user community· Follow all applicable policies and controls· Ensure customer data and sensitive data is transmitted using approved channels· Maintain the integrity of the sensitive customer data in line with policies and controls Experience and Education: · Degree in finance or related discipline· Interest or experience in banking, financial risk management or financial technology· Understanding of a bank's balance sheet· Understanding of fixed income instruments· Understanding of accounting and financial statements· Advanced knowledge of Excel· Experience working with large datasets· Strong attention to detail and good planning and organization skills Preferred skills: · Progress toward a CFA, FRM or PRM certification· Understanding of interest rate derivatives· Bank internship experience · Knowledge of SQL or Python

description: Intern at AutoMultiListCompany Overview:AutoMultiList is a cutting-edge technology startup based in Los Angeles CA. We are dedicated to simplifying the car-selling process. We help people eliminate the hassle of selling their vehicles through our innovative solution. As we launch our platform, we are looking for capable self-starters to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in bringing our product to market.Position: InternLocation: RemoteDuration: 6 monthsType: Part-TimeKey Responsibilities:Collaborate with team members to develop and refine sales strategies and marketing plans.Contribute ideas for enhancing our technology and user experience.Assist in market research to understand customer needs and industry trends.Engage in sales and business development process.Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions to foster collaboration and innovation.Work independently on assigned tasks while maintaining effective communication with the team.Essential Skills:Self-Motivated: Ability to take initiative, work independently, and manage time effectively.Technology Minded: A passion for technology and understanding of its applications in the automotive space.Sales Understanding: Basic knowledge of sales principles and an interest in developing sales skills.Creativity and Open-Mindedness: Willingness to share innovative ideas and approaches to problem-solving.Collaborative Spirit: Eagerness to learn from others and work effectively within a team environment.What You Will Gain:A unique opportunity to immerse yourself in the automotive and technology industries.Hands-on experience in sales, management, technology development, and business leadership.Insight into the startup ecosystem, entrepreneurship, and strategies for building and growing a business.Mentorship from experienced professionals dedicated to your growth and success.If you are a driven individual eager to learn and make an impact, we invite you to apply for this exciting internship opportunity at AutoMultiList. We’re excited to meet you and look forward to working together to revolutionize the car-selling experience!How to Apply:Please send your resume and why you think you'd be a good fit to - Griffen@AutoMultiList.com
Requirements: Collaborate with team members to develop and refine sales strategies and marketing plans. Contribute ideas for enhancing our technology and user experience. Assist in market research to understand customer needs and industry trends. Engage in sales and business development process. Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions to foster collaboration and innovation. Work independently on assigned tasks while maintaining effective communication with the team.,

description: From zero trust architecture and cloud delivery to security automation and beyond, Easy Dynamics delivers cutting-edge innovation and steady guidance in an ever-changing IT landscape and we’re growing. Come join our team! We are a fast-paced organization that values our people and always strives for excellence. Our delivery practices lean heavily on Agile methodology and our technologists are top notch. The Easy Dynamics culture is one of connection and collaboration across teams to ensure that we always put our best foot forward. Being in growth mode means that we are small enough that no idea is too small for discussion, and everyone can be an impact player. We are looking for a dynamic Organizational Change Management (OCM) leader to join our team. In this role, you'll be responsible for leading OCM and communications for a large Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) program. This includes leading content creation and approval, training, internal communications, integration with the project teams to track and vet progress, and support of implemented change. Responsibilities:Influence a change management methodology and tools; to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, and identify key stakeholders Identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics Support organizational design and definition of roles and responsibilities Integrate change management activities into the project plan Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress Support change management at the enterprise level Coordinating any major change across the enterprise, such as policy, technological, operational, and governance changes Create change plans and documents to outline project expectations, scope, schedule, and budget requirements Conducting workshops to provide clients with information on any major changes Spotting any change-related issues and creating effective solutions to resolve them swiftly Qualifications: Bachelor's degreeExperience with and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies Recipient of a Change Management Certification, via ACMP Qualified Education ProviderDemonstrated understanding of the Standard for Change ManagementExperience with and knowledge of Digital Transformation management principles and methodologiesExpertise in project management, as well as transition documentation, tools, and templates Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Good time management and organizational skills Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere Able to work effectively at all levels of an organization Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts Excellent managerial skills Strong analytical skills Preferred Qualifications:Experience with enterprise program and/or change management within federal governmentFamiliar with digital identity concepts and program deliveryCertified Change Management Professional CertificationSalary Range: $100,000 - $125,000

able to work in ambiguous situations Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere Able to work effectively at all levels of an organization Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts Excellent managerial skills Strong analytical skills, Experience with enterprise program and/or change management within federal government Familiar with digital identity concepts and program delivery Certified Change Management Professional Certification

description: Job Title:Engineer InternshipDepartment:Research & DevelopmentReports to:Manager of DevelopmentOwl Cyber Defense is a leader and trusted partner in cyber security. We deliver solutions that protect and connect the world’s most critical networks. Owl’s product lines of cross domain, data diode, and portable media solutions provide the strongest available security checkpoints for threat prevention and secure data availability. Our in-depth expertise in security engineering at the operating system level enables us to help government and commercial customers meet ever-evolving cyber security threats.Job Summary:Owl is recruiting for several engineering internships for the Summer of 2024 across the following areas: Software DevelopmentDevOpsQuality & Test EngineeringSystems EngineeringHardware EngineeringOur internship positions offer the opportunity to work with experienced engineers and will contribute to the development, testing, integration, and support of various Owl products across a number of cybersecurity product lines. Successful candidates should have experience working on Linux platforms for development and test efforts across various development languages.Owl's internships require an on site presence for hands on work, and mentoring. Candidates must be able to be local to an Owl office location (Columbia, MD, Danbury, CT or Morrisville, NC) for the Summer to work a hybrid schedule of ~2-3 days in the office.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Follow best practices for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Operating System, configuration for security, application of updates, modifying Owl software configuration for both existing and new solutionsCreate RPMs of softwareDefine systems to meet security best practices (STIGs/CIS)Implement Linux solutions to support the security control standardsSetup and Test new hardware platforms that are developedScripting using Python and/or BashConfigure Owl Applications and define tests plans to match system requirementsSupport the Owl Product Development Life CycleTrack open issues and assist in future release planningOther duties as management may so directQualifications:Coursework leading to a college degree in a relevant field of study. (i.e., engineering, computer science, physics, etc.)Previous Internships or other work in the field is highly desirableTechnical Skills:Experience in C, C++, and/or JavaScripting experience with Python, and/or BashKnowledge of Unix/Linux systemsExperience with debugging software such as gdbExperience with unit testing frameworks such as CUnit and UnittestKnowledge of networking protocols such as TCP/IP and UDP/IPExperience with version control software (i.e. Git, Subversion, CVS) a plusSoft Skills:Must have good communication skills, verbal and writtenAble to work in team environments and be open to mentoringAbility to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environmentAbility to prioritize to complete tasks in a timely mannerCandidates must be able to obtain/maintain a US Government security clearanceAbout Owl Cyber Defense Solutions, LLCOwl Cyber Defense Solutions, LLC is a fast-growing cybersecurity solutions company, holding a firm leadership position in network security and secure information transfer. It is a privately-owned US company with offices in Columbia, MD, Danbury, CT and Morrisville, NC. For more information, see http://www.owlcyberdefense.com.Owl Cyber Defense is Proud to be an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer.
Requirements: Follow best practices for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Operating System, configuration for security, application of updates, modifying Owl software configuration for both existing and new solutions Create RPMs of software Define systems to meet security best practices (STIGs/CIS) Implement Linux solutions to support the security control standards Setup and Test new hardware platforms that are developed Scripting using Python and/or Bash Configure Owl Applications and define tests plans to match system requirements Support the Owl Product Development Life Cycle Track open issues and assist in future release planning Other duties as management may so direct, Coursework leading to a college degree in a relevant field of study. (i.e., engineering, computer science, physics, etc.) Previous Internships or other work in the field is highly desirable Technical Skills: Experience in C, C++, and/or Java Scripting experience with Python, and/or Bash Knowledge of Unix/Linux systems Experience with debugging software such as gdb Experience with unit testing frameworks such as CUnit and Unittest Knowledge of networking protocols such as TCP/IP and UDP/IP Experience with version control software (i.e. Git, Subversion, CVS) a plus Soft Skills: Must have good communication skills, verbal and written Able to work in team environments and be open to mentoring Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment Ability to prioritize to complete tasks in a timely manner Candidates must be able to obtain/maintain a US Government security clearance Experience in C, C++, and/or Java Scripting experience with Python, and/or Bash Knowledge of Unix/Linux systems Experience with debugging software such as gdb Experience with unit testing frameworks such as CUnit and Unittest Knowledge of networking protocols such as TCP/IP and UDP/IP Experience with version control software (i.e. Git, Subversion, CVS) a plus Scripting experience with Python, and/or Bash Must have good communication skills, verbal and written Able to work in team environments and be open to mentoring Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment Ability to prioritize to complete tasks in a timely manner

description: IT Systems AdministratorComputer Packages Inc., a global software company, is seeking an IT Systems Administrator who will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and efficiency of our IT systems. You will work on a team to: manage and maintain our IT infrastructure; diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues; install, configure, and maintain software applications, operating systems, and active Directory environments; monitor and manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls; work with our cyber-security admin. to enforce security measures to protect against cyber threats and unauthorized access.Requirements: BS degree in computer science or other technical degree preferred. Experience with Office 365, Windows server environment and Active Directory services a plus. Solid understanding of networking protocols, configurations, and troubleshooting. Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.) a plus. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal abilities. We offer an excellent salary and benefits package along with relocation assistance, visa sponsorship, and opportunity for growth. Resumes only to cpijobs@computerpackages.com

description: Solution Architect Intern - Unpaid About Us:Find Me is an innovative startup focused on creating cutting-edge applications. We are currently in the designing phase and gearing up to launch our product soon. Our team is passionate about technology and driven to make a difference in the IT field. Located in the United States, we offer remote work flexibility to our team members. We are looking for an experienced Solution Architect to lead the development of a mobile application that delivers high performance, scalability, and security. The Solution Architect will collaborate with product managers, developers, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to define the technical direction, architectural standards, and ensure the mobile app meets business objectives and user needs. You will be responsible for guiding the technical team through development, ensuring best practices, and making architectural decisions that align with the long-term product vision. Key Responsibilities:Lead the architecture and design of mobile applications, ensuring alignment with business requirements and technical goals.Define and document mobile application architecture, including data models, APIs, microservices, and backend systems.Ensure the scalability, performance, and security of mobile applications across iOS and Android platforms.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and translate functional and technical requirements into well-architected mobile solutions.Oversee the implementation of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to support mobile app functions such as authentication, data storage, and notifications.Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams, conducting code reviews and establishing coding standards.Collaborate closely with DevOps to ensure a streamlined CI/CD pipeline, automated testing, and efficient deployment processes.Ensure mobile apps are optimized for speed, performance, and user experience, with a focus on minimal resource consumption (battery, memory).Address and mitigate security risks, ensuring compliance with data privacy laws and security best practices.Stay updated on the latest mobile development trends, frameworks, and emerging technologies to guide future app development strategies.Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.5+ years of experience in software development, with 3+ years in mobile app architecture and design.Proficiency in mobile development frameworks and languages (e.g., Swift, Kotlin, React Native, Flutter, Java).Solid understanding of backend services, microservices architecture, and APIs for mobile apps.Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for mobile app development and deployment.Strong knowledge of mobile app security, including encryption, authentication, and secure coding practices.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present technical solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications:Experience in designing and developing cross-platform mobile applications.Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, or GitLab CI/CD.Prior experience in mobile app development in any domain is a plus. Benefits:Gain hands-on experience in product management within a startup environment.Opportunity to earn academic credits.Chance to convert this internship into a full-time role based on performance.Work with a dynamic and innovative team in a fast-growing startup. How to Apply:To apply, please send your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this opportunity to hr@fyndme.net. We look forward to seeing your work and how you can contribute to the future of retail technology. Note: This is an unpaid internship with the possibility of academic credits and a potential full-time position based on performance.
Requirements: Lead the architecture and design of mobile applications, ensuring alignment with business requirements and technical goals. Define and document mobile application architecture, including data models, APIs, microservices, and backend systems. Ensure the scalability, performance, and security of mobile applications across iOS and Android platforms. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and translate functional and technical requirements into well-architected mobile solutions. Oversee the implementation of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to support mobile app functions such as authentication, data storage, and notifications. Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams, conducting code reviews and establishing coding standards. Collaborate closely with DevOps to ensure a streamlined CI/CD pipeline, automated testing, and efficient deployment processes. Ensure mobile apps are optimized for speed, performance, and user experience, with a focus on minimal resource consumption (battery, memory). Address and mitigate security risks, ensuring compliance with data privacy laws and security best practices. Stay updated on the latest mobile development trends, frameworks, and emerging technologies to guide future app development strategies., Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field. 5+ years of experience in software development, with 3+ years in mobile app architecture and design. Proficiency in mobile development frameworks and languages (e.g., Swift, Kotlin, React Native, Flutter, Java). Solid understanding of backend services, microservices architecture, and APIs for mobile apps. Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for mobile app development and deployment. Strong knowledge of mobile app security, including encryption, authentication, and secure coding practices. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present technical solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders., Experience in designing and developing cross-platform mobile applications. Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, or GitLab CI/CD. Prior experience in mobile app development in any domain is a plus.
requirements: Solution Architect Intern - Unpaid About Us:Find Me is an innovative startup focused on creating cutting-edge applications. We are currently in the designing phase and gearing up to launch our product soon. Our team is passionate about technology and driven to make a difference in the IT field. Located in the United States, we offer remote work flexibility to our team members. We are looking for an experienced Solution Architect to lead the development of a mobile application that delivers high performance, scalability, and security. The Solution Architect will collaborate with product managers, developers, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to define the technical direction, architectural standards, and ensure the mobile app meets business objectives and user needs. You will be responsible for guiding the technical team through development, ensuring best practices, and making architectural decisions that align with the long-term product vision. Key description: DRB Systems (“DRB”) is the leading provider of technology-enabled devices and software solutions to the North American car wash industry. The Internal Communications Intern is responsible for running multiple projects aimed at enhancing the culture and team member engagement at DRB.JOB PURPOSE:Would you enjoy hands-on experience with internal communications strategies and tactics — applying your education with real-life projects? In this role, you will work to help identify and execute creative communication and culture-building initiatives, with the goal of fostering an environment where DRB team members can thrive together. You will also conduct research around employee experience best practices and help translate into successful communications strategies. If this sounds like you, then join us as the Internal Communications Intern at DRB. This position reports to the Internal Communications Manager and is located in Green, Ohio.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of these essential functions at a satisfactory level. Other essential and non-essential functions may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Learn the basics of internal communications and how the employee experience drives engagement.· Assist with internal communications programs including, but not limited to: content creation, copywriting and video & graphics production.· Provide support to our Internal Communications Manager· Coordinate with our Digital Marketing team relating to potential social media content.· Assist with project tasks and coordination.· Assist in managing multiple communication platforms (email, digital display, intranet) to ensure seamless coordination.· Help distribute communication materials.· Aid in planning and executing cultural events.· Additional internal communications projects as assigned.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: A rising Junior – Senior level student pursuing a degree in Communications, Organization Development, Marketing, or related field.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Knowledgeable in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Viva Engage, Teams)Passion for the internal communications field and its best practices.Organization and time management skills. Vontier (NYSE: VNT) is a global industrial technology company uniting productivity, automation and multi-energy technologies to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving, more connected mobility ecosystem. Leveraging leading market positions, decades of domain expertise and unparalleled portfolio breadth, Vontier enables the way the world moves – delivering smart, safe and sustainable solutions to our customers and the planet. Vontier has a culture of continuous improvement and innovation built upon the foundation of the Vontier Business System and embraced by colleagues worldwide. Additional information about Vontier is available on the Company’s website at www.vontier.com.The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Vontier Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as “Vontier Company”.Vontier is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strive to build inclusive environments and ensure equitable access, opportunity, and treatment for all. Vontier does not tolerate discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, gender identity or expression, gender information and any other characteristics protected by law. We make hiring decisions based on your experience and skills. Vontier is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation in the application or interview process, you may contact us at e-mail vnttalentacquisition@vontier.com. Equal Opportunity Employer

description: Job Description: Account ExecutiveLocation: Local preferred, remote acceptable (Minneapolis/St. Paul)Status: Full-Time EmployeePosition Summary:Terrapin Technologies is seeking an Account Executive (AE) to drive revenue growth by targeting bank-based broker-dealers, independent broker-dealers, and hybrid RIAs in the wealth management industry, turning these prospects into lasting partnerships. You’ll build a customer base through proactive prospecting and inbound/outbound efforts, collaborating through each stage of the sales cycle to meet the specific needs of wealth management customers. Post-sale, you'll cultivate relationships with key contacts to foster customer satisfaction and identify opportunities for growth within each account. As this is a new position, we’re looking for someone who is flexible, adaptable, and eager to shape the role's future at Terrapin.Compensation:On Target Earnings: $130,000 - $160,000, including a base salary of $65,000 - $80,000As an Account Executive, you will:Generate and Manage Sales Pipeline: Proactively generate new leads through outreach and inbound inquiries, build a robust customer pipeline, and manage each prospect through the sales funnel to ensure smooth transitions from initial contact to deal closure.Develop Consultative Relationships: Build trust by understanding prospect needs and delivering tailored solutions, serving as the main point of contact through the sales process. Post-sale, maintain strong relationships to support renewals and identify opportunities for additional services.Collaborate with Internal Teams: Partner with internal teams to drive new business, enhance customer onboarding, support daily account needs, and provide insights to improve Terrapin's offerings.Strategic Prospect Engagement: Use data and tools like HubSpot to efficiently identify and reach prospects, aligning outreach with marketing efforts to maximize engagement.Travel: Limited travel (<10%) to industry events and customer sites to build relationships and represent Terrapin in person.Key Skills & Attributes:Consultative & Solution-Based Selling: Skilled in listening to customer needs, identifying challenges, and recommending tailored Terrapin solutions. Uses a consultative approach to build trust and customize offerings that address customer requirements and market opportunities.Prospecting & Relationship Building: Proactive in outreach, skilled in building rapport, and committed to nurturing genuine, long-term customer relationships that drive sales.Technical Communication: Able to discuss complex, technical topics in a clear and accessible manner, adapting language to meet the needs of various stakeholders and ensuring understanding across customer teams.Adaptability & Collaboration: Flexible to adjust to customer needs, collaborate closely with leadership and internal teams, and contribute to go-to-market strategies and continuous improvement efforts.Tech-Savvy: Proficient in using CRM tools (preferably HubSpot) to manage the pipeline effectively, skilled at creating and enhancing compelling sales presentations with presentation software, and adept at performing data analysis through spreadsheets. Capable of leveraging data and insights to build persuasive business cases that streamline the sales process.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or a related field.2+ years of experience in sales development, business development, or a customer-facing role, with a strong track record in consultative sales or relationship management.Proven ability to build and manage relationships with key stakeholders in B2B environments.Strong verbal and written communication skills and proficiency with CRM software, preferably HubSpot.Passion for technology and data solutions, with previous experience in SaaS sales or the wealth management sector being a plus.Demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding sales quotas or KPIs, ideally in a role requiring a mix of prospecting and account management.Benefits and PerksComprehensive insurance, including health, dental, vision, disability, and life insuranceHealth Savings Account (HSA)Flexible paid time off and holidays, including a floating holiday to use for your birthdayHybrid, work from home (remote), and in-office options401(k) with a generous employer matchCellular service plan stipendConvenient office location with access to light railCompany ProfileFounded in 1995, our expertise and technology solutions have helped our customers realize scalable and predictable growth. Our digital platform is designed to automate and improve business processes across the entire firm, including compensation, compliance, and reporting. The web-based technology helps wealth management firms increase productivity and operational efficiency, achieve maximum compliance with minimum effort, and make data-driven business decisions. Our passion for getting data in good order, obsession with finding the best solution, and dogged commitment to our customer’s success, set us apart from other providers.
Requirements: , Consultative & Solution-Based Selling: Skilled in listening to customer needs, identifying challenges, and recommending tailored Terrapin solutions. Uses a consultative approach to build trust and customize offerings that address customer requirements and market opportunities. Prospecting & Relationship Building: Proactive in outreach, skilled in building rapport, and committed to nurturing genuine, long-term customer relationships that drive sales. Technical Communication: Able to discuss complex, technical topics in a clear and accessible manner, adapting language to meet the needs of various stakeholders and ensuring understanding across customer teams. Adaptability & Collaboration: Flexible to adjust to customer needs, collaborate closely with leadership and internal teams, and contribute to go-to-market strategies and continuous improvement efforts. Tech-Savvy: Proficient in using CRM tools (preferably HubSpot) to manage the pipeline effectively, skilled at creating and enhancing compelling sales presentations with presentation software, and adept at performing data analysis through spreadsheets. Capable of leveraging data and insights to build persuasive business cases that streamline the sales process., Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in sales development, business development, or a customer-facing role, with a strong track record in consultative sales or relationship management. Proven ability to build and manage relationships with key stakeholders in B2B environments. Strong verbal and written communication skills and proficiency with CRM software, preferably HubSpot. Passion for technology and data solutions, with previous experience in SaaS sales or the wealth management sector being a plus. Demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding sales quotas or KPIs, ideally in a role requiring a mix of prospecting and account management.

description: DRB Systems (“DRB”) is the leading provider of technology-enabled devices and software solutions to the North American car wash industry. The Marketing Intern is responsible for running multiple projects supporting DRB product line.JOB PURPOSE:Would you enjoy hands-on experience with planning, organization and execution of tradeshow events — applying your education with real-life projects? The intern will play a vital role in managing logistics, coordinating with vendors, preparing marketing materials, and ensuring smooth operations during events. This position is designed to offer valuable learning opportunities in event management, project coordination, and cross-functional collaboration, while directly impacting the company's ability to showcase products, engage with industry professionals, and generate leads at key industry events. If this sounds like you, then join us as the Marketing Intern at DRB. This position reports to the Trade Show Manager and is located in Green, Ohio.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of these essential functions at a satisfactorily level. Other essential and non-essential functions may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Assist in planning and coordinating all logistical aspects of tradeshow participation, including booth setup, shipping, and vendor management.· Support the creation and preparation of marketing materials, product displays, and promotional items for tradeshows.· Help manage timelines and ensure that key deliverables are met leading up to each event.· Coordinate with external vendors for services such as booth construction, transportation, and on-site support.· Participate in pre-show planning meetings and post-show debriefs.· Assist with on-site event management, including booth setup and breakdown, staff coordination, and attendee engagement (if applicable).· Track and report on event performance metrics, gathering feedback to improve future events.· Maintain an organized inventory of tradeshow materials and marketing collateral.· Provide administrative support, including scheduling, documentation, and maintaining communication with internal teams.· Maintain internal communication website· Additional marketing projects as assigned.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: A rising Junior or Senior pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Event Management, or a related field.Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Detail-oriented and proactive with the ability to problem-solve on the fly.Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).Interest in event management and marketing is a plus.Experience with event or tradeshow coordination (even through school projects or volunteering) is a plus but not required. Vontier (NYSE: VNT) is a global industrial technology company uniting productivity, automation and multi-energy technologies to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving, more connected mobility ecosystem. Leveraging leading market positions, decades of domain expertise and unparalleled portfolio breadth, Vontier enables the way the world moves – delivering smart, safe and sustainable solutions to our customers and the planet. Vontier has a culture of continuous improvement and innovation built upon the foundation of the Vontier Business System and embraced by colleagues worldwide. Additional information about Vontier is available on the Company’s website at www.vontier.com.The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Vontier Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as “Vontier Company”.Vontier is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strive to build inclusive environments and ensure equitable access, opportunity, and treatment for all. Vontier does not tolerate discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, gender identity or expression, gender information and any other characteristics protected by law. description: Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. It’s a big mission, and even though we've made a lot of headway, we still have work to do — and that’s where you come in!Our Product Managers (PMs) have ownership over product optimizations and features, from independently run experiments to major product decisions. Backed by strong analytical skills and business acumen, and inspired by access to senior leadership and transparency into how they make product decisions, our PMs develop insights that lead to new product ideas and Duolingo’s next beloved feature. Join our life-changing mission to develop education for our half a billion (and growing!) learners around the world. You will...Lead a specific feature of the app, seeing it through the entire product development cycle: ideation, specification, development, release, analysis, and iterationConduct research, analyze market trends and data and develop a product roadmap for a key component of Duolingo’s business (past projects include: teaching Asian languages better, exploring strategy for emerging markets, and product improvements to attract more offline learners)Work with engineers and designers to help guide feature developmentPerform quantitative analysis on features’ performance and find opportunities for optimization What we’re looking for…Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in a technical or business field with an expected graduation date of Spring 2027 (or Fall 2026)Demonstrated leadership skillsAbility to utilize user insights, data, and statistical analyses to inform decisionsAn instinct for creating simple and intuitive user experiencesShown ability to learn fastDemonstrated ability to be inventive and innovativeA desire to make the world a better place through technology and education Why you’ll love working here…Language learning opportunitiesCatered in-house lunches, and breakfast and dinner optionsCompany-wide HackathonPTO and company holidaysFrequent company-wide dinners, monthly celebrations, social clubs, and so much more!Take a peek at how we care for our employees' holistic well-being with our benefits here.We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please contact your recruiter.Duolingo is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.By applying for this position your data will be processed as per the Duolingo Applicant Privacy Notice.

description: The Hospitality Shared Services Team has an immediate opening for a senior Java Developer. This position will be part of a large, distributed and tightly-knit team dedicated to implementing, enhancing and supporting the core services for Sabre Hospitality Solutions. What will you achieve?Designs and codes applications using advanced technology; envisioning system features and functionality throughout development life cycleDetermines design methodologies and completes programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests.Assesses and recommends the best technical solutions for complex projectsCreates new ideas to improve application performance, stability and security.Controls quality of coding and implementationMultitasks and supervises work of junior team membersSupports users by developing documentation and assistance tools.Works in the fast-paced environmentBrings a passion to learn and the best development practices to the teamAccurately estimates software development projects based on business requirements.Works closely with other cross functional teams in doing design, development & deployment of the applicationJob Requirements Skills:Strong experience in Java with experience on design patterns.Experience with unit (JUnit), functional and performance testing methodologies and toolsHave experience working with Java 8 or above, Spring 4.x or above, Maven, Tomcat, LinuxHave strong experience working with JDBC, RDMS and NoSQLExperience with Cloud and containerization is a plusExperience with developing and consuming REST APIsResearch and recommend design options and create proof of concepts for potential design feasibility for the applicationHave experience participating in Agile practices such as Test-Driven Development (TDD), refactoring, and design principles like DRY, SOLID, etc.Understanding of highly complex engineering systems like parallelization, multithreading. Background:Typically, 5+ years of hands-on software engineering experience as Senior Software EngineerProven programming skills with strong computer science fundamentals with bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer EngineeringExperience in hospitality or travel domain is a plusExperience with PHP is a plus What's in it for you?Working with one of the leading hotel property management system. Sky is the limit when it comes to what you can do.Opportunity to do something that has high impact and game changingBecome part of a company built on Passion, Curiosity, Transparency, Partnership, Rigor and AccountabilityBe part of one of the world’s largest Travel and Hospitality technology companyLots of fun and employee development events Sabre offers the following outstanding benefits: Very competitive compensation Generous Paid Time Off (25 PTO days)4 days (one day/quarter) Volunteer Time Off (VTO)5 days off annually for Year-End Break13 recognized US company holidays12 weeks paid parental leaveWe offer a comprehensive medical, dental and Wellness ProgramAn infrastructure that allows flexible working arrangements Formal and informal reward, recognition and acknowledgement programs
Requirements: Strong experience in Java with experience on design patterns. Experience with unit (JUnit), functional and performance testing methodologies and tools Have experience working with Java 8 or above, Spring 4.x or above, Maven, Tomcat, Linux Have strong experience working with JDBC, RDMS and NoSQL Experience with Cloud and containerization is a plus Experience with developing and consuming REST APIs Research and recommend design options and create proof of concepts for potential design feasibility for the application Have experience participating in Agile practices such as Test-Driven Development (TDD), refactoring, and design principles like DRY, SOLID, etc. Understanding of highly complex engineering systems like parallelization, multithreading., Typically, 5+ years of hands-on software engineering experience as Senior Software Engineer Proven programming skills with strong computer science fundamentals with bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering Experience in hospitality or travel domain is a plus Experience with PHP is a plus

description: Description DRB (A Vontier Company) is the leading provider of technology-enabled devices and software solutions to the North American car care industry.WHAT WE DO: enabling the future of vehicle care – wherever the road takes you.WHY WE DO IT: To fuel our client’s growth with connected, data-led technology, driven by our spirit of innovation and commitment to excellence.ABOUT THE ROLE:Are you a natural problem solver? Do you like to be hands-on and focus on continuous improvement? Are you results-driven and detail-oriented? We are looking for students with an interest in Business Management, or Project Management who want to make an impact. If you are looking for a dynamic company to start and grow your career, we want to talk with you. If this sounds like you, then join us as a Support Operations Intern at DRB.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of these essential functions at a satisfactorily level. Other essential and non-essential functions may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Develop new skills and build professional relationships with friendly, experienced co-workers.· Develop knowledge and understanding around key initiatives and priorities.· Learn how internal teams work together to assist our largest customers.· Research ways to help manage team member experience and tracking of team member feedback.· Gain an understanding of internal feedback loops, development programs and identify areas for improvement.· Provide recommendations based on findings and knowledge gained.· Foster analytical skills to drive impact on overall business objectives.· Find insights and trends in team member feedback.· Develop, manage, and execute specific projects with defined deliverables.· Deliver an end-of-project presentation to the DRB senior leadership team. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:A rising Sophomore – Senior level student pursuing a degree in Business, Organizational Development, Project Management, or related field.Strong attention to detail and sense of urgency.Strong Excel skills.Excellent communicator with a positive, self-starter attitude.Desire to learn new things.Available to work onsite in Green, OH. (potential hybrid option)Hybrid role is Monday through Friday, 40 hours per weekStrong analytical and problem-solving ability Vontier is a $3B global industrial technology company focused on smarter transportation and mobility. Our six operating companies—Gilbarco Veeder-Root, Global Traffic Technologies, Teletrac Navman, Matco Tools, Hennessy Industries, and DRB Systems—are united by a powerful purpose: mobilizing the future to create a better world. Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and sustainability worldwide.The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Vontier Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as “Vontier Company”.Vontier is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strive to build inclusive environments and ensure equitable access, opportunity, and treatment for all. Vontier does not tolerate discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, gender identity or expression, gender information and any other characteristics protected by law. We make hiring decisions based on your experience and skills. Vontier is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation in the application or interview process, you may contact us at e-mail vnttalentacquisition@vontier.com. Equal Opportunity Employer

description: Welcome to Tanbii - Your Green Journey Awaits!Embark on a revolutionary eco-friendly adventure with Tanbii! Our app goes beyond traditional carbon tracking, offering a dynamic and engaging platform to transform your daily activities into positive environmental actions. Tanbii isn't just an app; it's a movement towards a sustainable future. Track, earn, play, and plant – have fun while making a difference. Join us in creating a positive impact on the planet, one virtual tree and token at a time. Also, Tanbii is an impact-first innovative company inspiring eco-conscious individuals to cut carbon footprints. Our app gamifies real-world carbon reduction. Rewarding users with tokens for sustainability efforts. Are You:Passionate about Sustainability and Climate Change?Interested in Virtual Worlds and Gaming?Want to be rewarded for living sustainably?Want to get experience working for a venture-backed, fast-growing startup and get in on the ground floorDo you want to support the creation of world-class, cutting-edge technology?Do you have experience in developing mobile games? Yes? Then come join us at Tanbii!We think you’re fantastic.We think building eco-gaming software to increase human agency is good.We also think it’s good business! What is Tanbii?Tanbii is a planet-impact universe that bridges the real and virtual worlds for a greener planet. Reduce carbon in the real world, and get rewarded in the virtual world. We financially incentivize people to reduce personal carbon emissions in a simple, fun, and safe way. Reduce to earn. At the same, we help brands to reduce waste and generate more revenues. It’s a win-win for everyone.Eco-Gaming is a concept created by Tanbii that bridges the gap between real and virtual worlds. The carbon emission you reduce in the real world helps you get rewarded in the virtual world. Requirements:Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Computer Science, Game Design, or a related field.Must be able to complete an internship lasting a minimum of twelve (12) weeks.Ability to work 20-40 hours per week for a 12-week periodMust have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher Minimum Qualifications:Knowledge of mobile gaming platformsProficiency in programming languages including C#, .NET, and Java, among othersProficiency in game development tools and technologies, such as Unity, as well as other relevant tools and technologies in the field of game development.Excellent communication and analytical skillsBasic understanding of game design principles, mechanics, and player psychology.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues.Experience with QA testing methodologies, tools, and techniques is a plus.Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving industry trends. What We Can Offer YouA dynamic and highly collaborative founding team of successful serial entrepreneurs, ex-Google from Harvard, Wharton, Columbia, and USCFully, 100% Remote (US)Full Time or Part TimeClass CreditFun and motivating working environmentBe recognized in numerous prestigious publications and awardsReduce your carbon footprint and be the savior of our planet!For our best student interns, this is a pathway to a full-time role upon graduation!! 【SUBMISSION】Send your resume & Role Name to Koda - Tanbii directly at our Discord(https://discord.gg/6KM3zaTa9E)
Requirements: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Computer Science, Game Design, or a related field. Must be able to complete an internship lasting a minimum of twelve (12) weeks. Ability to work 20-40 hours per week for a 12-week period Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher, Knowledge of mobile gaming platforms Proficiency in programming languages including C#, .NET, and Java, among others Proficiency in game development tools and technologies, such as Unity, as well as other relevant tools and technologies in the field of game development. Excellent communication and analytical skills Basic understanding of game design principles, mechanics, and player psychology. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues. Experience with QA testing methodologies, tools, and techniques is a plus. Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving industry trends.

description: We are looking for Software Engineers to join us during our Summer 2025 internship program.As a Software Engineer Intern, you will design and develop AI applications using the C3 AI Suite. Software Engineers may be assigned to work on our platform or solutions engineering teams. You will collaborate to do meaningful work while also growing your expertise.Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain performant and scalable applications.Build and improve tools for internal C3 teams to understand and analyze large-scale data.Work closely with and incorporate feedback from Products and Engineering teams.Define and lead end-to-end development of applications.Qualifications:Pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields.Experience with JavaScript, Java, or other object-oriented programming language.Strong hands-on experience and understanding of object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, profiling & optimization.Real passion for developing team-oriented solutions to complex engineering problems.Thrive in an autonomous, empowering and exciting environment.Great verbal and written communication skills to collaborate multi-functionally and improve scalability.Interest in committing to a fun, friendly, expansive, and intellectually stimulating environment.C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include: Salary range: $6,000 - $8,000 USD per month.At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.
Requirements: Design, develop, and maintain performant and scalable applications. Build and improve tools for internal C3 teams to understand and analyze large-scale data. Work closely with and incorporate feedback from Products and Engineering teams. Define and lead end-to-end development of applications., Pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields. Experience with JavaScript, Java, or other object-oriented programming language. Strong hands-on experience and understanding of object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, profiling & optimization. Real passion for developing team-oriented solutions to complex engineering problems. Thrive in an autonomous, empowering and exciting environment. Great verbal and written communication skills to collaborate multi-functionally and improve scalability. Interest in committing to a fun, friendly, expansive, and intellectually stimulating environment. C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include: Salary range: $6,000 - $8,000 USD per month. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.

description: Resilience, Inc. is a nonprofit organization that is dedicated to improving the mental health of students, as well as reducing mass shootings, suicide, and depression. Resilience, Inc also works to combat declining test scores, low student engagement, and a slew of other social issues. Our organization focuses on offering Social Emotional Learning tools to enable K-12 schools to teach emotional intelligence through five core topics; self-awareness, self-control, social awareness, relationship management, goal setting, and effective decision-making. Resilience, Inc. also provides tools for acquiring and maintaining inspiration, hope, and overall well-being. Our mission is to teach SEL at every school in the country. It is a tough challenge, but we know “No Challenge, No Change.” If you are also concerned about children’s mental health and social being, join us! Become a member of Resilience, Inc, and help change the way schools approach mental health. Resilience offers internship programs that require at least a 4 month commitment with a minimum of 5 hours per week. There are flexible start and end dates with the option to continue after meeting the minimum requirementSome educational institutions require prior approval before the start of an internship. It is the responsibility of the student to check with their institution to be sure they meet any requirements before they accept a position. Job Summary:This person will oversee teams that are tackling projects such as our Outreach Team that pursues partnerships with organizations and school districts, our Sales Team which cultivates a amazing customer experience that converts free trial users or interested customers into premium subscriptions, and our SELENA Connections team which is relaunching our SELENA Connections program that creates a connection with international schools and schools located inside the United States using SEL curriculum. This person needs to be outgoing and determined to completing tasks and sharing the curriculum that Resilience offers with the world. This person also needs to have leadership qualities where they know how to instruct interns on how to complete a task and set expectations to ensure tasks are completed in a timely manner. This person also needs to have sales skills where they can possibly lead a sales team and set an example for everyone else. Check with your school's Internship Coordinator BEFORE accepting the hiring offer to determine if this position satisfies the criteria for receiving academic credit.

description: Job Summary We are seeking candidates for an entry-level position with a passion for working in the information technology field. This role is designed for individuals looking to build on their existing skills and take the next step in their career. From micro-services to the latest web framework, NetApp IT covers a wide gamut of technologies and applications, to deliver compelling solutions for our business.  As an IT employee, you would participate in planning, development, verification, troubleshooting and delivery of a system or major subsystems. This position requires an individual to be creative, team-oriented, technology savvy and driven to produce results.  We invest heavily in new talent. Your energy and fresh ideas are vital to cementing our position as a market -leader. We’ll push you beyond your comfort zone with a belief that no idea is off-limits. At the same time, you’ll have all the resources, mentoring and feedback you need to grow. What’s more, whatever your role, you can be yourself in a team that celebrates individuality and welcomes different perspectives.  Job Requirements Being part of or Information Technology group, you will work closely with a team that supports and enhances NetApp’s world-wide business processes and systems.  Our NetApp Emerging Talent roles differs depending on the team and scope of work but some potential areas of focus and skill sets are-    IT Systems:Excellent oral and written communication skillsExperience with IT systems (applications, servers, networking, etc) or IT practices (operations, change control, release management)Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional and technical team members to support deadlinesAbility to work independentlyStrong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize these in a customer-facing environment.Multi-tasking and organizational skillsSense of urgency and determination to complete work Analytics/Data Science:Creative and analytical approach to problem solvingProject experience in data analysis, statistical modeling and hypothesis testingWorking knowledge of one or more statistical analysis tools or languages & related libraries/packages: R (preferred), Python (preferred), SPSS, SAS, etc.Knowledge and application of concepts important in Machine Learning: e.g., cross-validation, regularization, bootstrapping, etc. Additional Details: Job Posting Info: This is a pipeline position that will be opened on a recurring basis and used to fill roles aligned with the required skill sets.Program Dates: This is fulltime role with a flexible start date in 2024. Recruiting efforts will be ongoing until specific teams find an ideal match.Thrive Together: NetApp’s approach to in-person and remote work will be a flexible hybrid model that emphasizes flexibility for employees and puts our talent first. Experience This position typically requires a Bachelors degree and 2 years of relevant work experience, a masters degree with no relevant experience, OR 6 years of industry relevant experience without a formal degree. Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know…Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities. We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future. If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us. USA Residents Only:The base salary hiring wage range for this position which the Company reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position in the specified geographic areas or locations, is [$86,310] – [$121,330]. Final compensation will be dependent on various factors relevant to the position and candidate such as geographical location, candidate qualifications, certifications, relevant job-related work experience, education, skillset and other relevant business and organizational factors, consistent with applicable law. In addition, the position may include some of the following comprehensive benefits such Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401(K), Paid Time off (PTO), sick time, leave of absence as per the FMLA and other relevant leave laws, Company bonus/commission, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s). Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know...Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.
