description: Job Summary:Resilience, Inc. is a nonprofit organization that is dedicated to improving the mental health of students, as well as reducing mass shootings, suicide, and depression. Resilience, Inc also works to combat declining test scores, low student engagement, and a slew of other social issues. Our organization focuses on offering Social Emotional Learning tools to enable K-12 schools to teach emotional intelligence through five core topics; self-awareness, self-control, social awareness, relationship management, goal setting, and effective decision-making. Resilience, Inc. also provides tools for acquiring and maintaining inspiration, hope, and overall well-being. Our mission is to teach SEL at every school in the country. It is a tough challenge, but we know “No Challenge, No Change.” If you are also concerned about children’s mental health and social being, join us! Become a member of Resilience, Inc, and help change the way schools approach mental health. Resilience offers unpaid internship programs that require at least a 6 month commitment with a minimum of 10-15 hours per week. There are flexible start and end dates with the option to continue after meeting the minimum requirementAlthough this is an unpaid internship, there is the opportunity to earn school credit. Some educational institutions require prior approval before the start of an internship. It is the responsibility of the student to check with their institution to be sure they meet any requirements before they accept a position.As the AIMEE Project Manager at Resilience, Inc., your primary responsibility is to oversee the development of the SELENA App. You will collaborate closely with developers, designers, and other team members as needed to ensure the successful execution of the project. Your role involves conducting weekly meetings to track progress, address challenges, and ensure that the team is aligned with project goals. Additionally, you will review and analyze business data to identify trends that can enhance engagement, performance, and overall user experience for staff members.Responsibilities and Activities:Project Updates in Striven: Regularly update the SELENA App project status in Striven, providing clear and concise updates, including relevant dates and information in the Notes section.Weekly Team Meetings: Organize and lead weekly team meetings to discuss progress, challenges, and next steps. Set clear agendas, invite all relevant team members, and create recurring events on the Striven calendar for easy tracking.Task Assignments and Deadlines: Review activities and deadlines with each team member during team meetings. Assign tasks with clear deadlines in Striven to ensure accountability and progress tracking.One-to-One Meetings: Conduct one-to-one meetings with team members at least once a month. Use these meetings to address individual concerns, provide feedback, and maintain an up-to-date project plan in the project hub within Striven.SELENA Curriculum Familiarity: Ensure all team members are familiar with the SELENA App's curriculum and goals. Develop project objectives that align with advancing the app's development and impact.Proactive Support and Training: Proactively offer assistance to other departments when necessary. Consistently provide training opportunities to enhance staff members' skills and understanding of the project.Communication and Reporting: Maintain regular communication with your direct supervisor, keeping them informed about project progress, challenges, and milestones. Encourage team members to adopt open communication practices as well.HR Coordination: If additional staff is required for the project, coordinate with the HR department to initiate the hiring process. Keep the team informed of any updates related to the recruitment process.Requirements:Strong project management skills with a track record of successful IT project delivery.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.Proficiency in using project management tools like Striven for task assignments, progress tracking, and documentation.An analytical mindset to review and interpret business data, identify trends, and suggest improvements.Proactive and solution-oriented approach to overcome challenges and ensure project success.Understanding of IT development processes and familiarity with app development lifecycles.Note: While this position is unpaid, it offers valuable experience in managing IT projects and contributing to the development of a significant app. As an IT Project Manager for the SELENA App, you will gain hands-on experience, build professional connections, and make a positive impact on the organization's mission to create resilient and empowered communities.

description: Position: TikTok Operations InternLocation: Hybrid - BaltimoreCompany: Bmore StudioAbout Us: Bmore Studio is a dynamic TikTok live creator agency devoted to empowering TikTok creators and partners to boost their followers, craft innovative content, and turn their creative abilities into lucrative opportunities.Key Responsibilities (One of below):- Influencer Recruitment: Identify and recruit promising new talents.- Influencer Training: Provide professional training and guidance to new influencers.- TikTok Live Operations: Plan and execute live streaming events to enhance engagement.- Content Creation: Collaborate with influencers to produce viral short video content.What We Offer:- Industry Leadership: Access to extensive resources and expertise in a leading MCN agency.- Innovative Environment: An open work environment that encourages creativity and individuality.- Technical Support: Strong technical backing to ensure smooth operations.- Our team is composed of serial entrepreneurs who have held important positions in well-known companies such as Google, YY, Bigo and Wells Fargo.- OPT Support: For current students, we offer OPT opportunities to gain valuable work experience.Benefits of Joining Us:- Practical Experience: Gain hands-on experience in TikTok platform operations.- Learning Opportunities: Engage in one-on-one learning and exchange with industry experts.- Project Involvement: Participate in real projects, enhancing personal skills and resume highlights.- Career Advancement: Exceptional interns may be offered full-time positions to kickstart their careers.Preferred Qualifications:Language Proficiency: Proficiency in Chinese (Mandarin) is preferred.Bmore Studio is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Requirements: - Influencer Recruitment: Identify and recruit promising new talents. - Influencer Training: Provide professional training and guidance to new influencers. - TikTok Live Operations: Plan and execute live streaming events to enhance engagement. - Content Creation: Collaborate with influencers to produce viral short video content., Language Proficiency: Proficiency in Chinese (Mandarin) is preferred. Bmore Studio is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description: We’re seeking a Salesforce Developer to join our Operations team, tasked with optimizing our Salesforce CRM to support rapid growth. You’ll transform sales team needs into robust Salesforce solutions, develop new features, troubleshoot issues, and enhance system efficiency.Ideal for those passionate about leveraging Salesforce technology to drive business success, this role offers the chance to work on critical projects, ensuring our CRM platform scales with our expanding operations.ResponsibilitiesUnderstand and translate business needs into Salesforce implementationsOptimize existing Salesforce configurations and develop new featuresParticipate in solution design and apply best practicesAnalyze and troubleshoot Salesforce issuesImprove Salesforce processes and propose solutions based on Salesforce capabilitiesEstimate efforts and follow development lifecycle processesMaintain Salesforce documentationRequirements and skillsDegree in IT, Computer Science, or related field2-5 years of experience in Salesforce developmentProficiency in Apex, SOQL, VisualForce, and Lightning componentsExperience with Salesforce architecture and custom codingSalesforce Developer Certification preferredFamiliarity with business process analysis and CRM systemsExcellent English and technical writing skillsExperience with cloud services and integrations is a plus

description: We're looking for outstanding individuals to join our team as a New Graduate. We recognize that the future of entertainment relies on groundbreaking technology and collaborative endeavors. As a New Graduate, you will be mentored by top engineers while contributing to impactful projects. Our world-class platform serves an extensive player base of over 79.5 million users every day, making this an outstanding chance to leave your mark.For more information, you can visit our Software Engineer site page here. You AreRequired: Pursued or pursuing an undergraduate degree in computer science, engineering or a related field with a focus on or deep interest in information sciences and studies, information assurance, information technology, or cybersecurity.Familiar with cyber security from school, internships, capture the flag competitions or other cybersecurity competitions, or previous jobs. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as GoLang, Python, RustUnderstanding of at least one of the following: application security, enterprise security, detection engineering, incident response, cloud security concepts, identity and access management, or industry best practices across many fields of securityInterest in cryptography and threat modeling You Will:Identify and address security risks that Roblox facesDesign, code, test, and debug features and ship code to productionReport to one of our teams within the Information Security group

description: Are you a Junior or Senior looking to gain practical, hands-on experience in the world of no-code automation while still pursuing your academic goals? At Boltflow, we are a leading No-Code Automation Agency, we are looking for a Campus Technology Ambassadors, where you will learn how to master no-code tools and present product demonstrations to various audiences. This unique paid internship is designed for students who are eager to learn and apply their skills in a real-world business environment.What You’ll Gain by Working with Us:🛠️ Practical, Hands-On Experience: You’ll work with cutting-edge no-code tools and technologies, gaining skills that directly complement your academic studies.📚 Educational Alignment: This internship offers the flexibility to fit around your academic calendar, ensuring your studies remain a priority. Your work with us can integrate with your university's coursework, and we’ll provide necessary support if you're seeking academic credit.🤝 Professional Networking: You’ll have opportunities to grow your network both on campus and within the broader tech industry.🌟 Collaborative Team Environment: Work closely with experienced professionals and be part of a dynamic, supportive team.💡 Deep Industry Insights: Learn about workflow automation and digital transformation, providing you with invaluable skills for future career opportunities.What We’re Looking For:🎓 Currently enrolled Junior or Senior in a university program.🗣️ Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with potential leads.💪 A desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced tech environment.⏰ Effective time management skills, balancing academic responsibilities with this flexible internship.❤️ Passion for technology and a genuine interest in no-code platforms and automation.Key Benefits:This internship provides significant learning opportunities, similar to what you'd experience in a classroom or hands-on educational environment. You’ll gain direct, practical experience in sales, lead generation, and no-code technologies.Commission-based earnings: For each successful lead you introduce, you'll be rewarded with competitive commissions, giving you the chance to earn while you learn.This internship offers flexibility, so you can balance it with your academic commitments. It provides a blend of educational value and practical experience, making it ideal for students seeking to complement their formal education with real-world business exposure.Ready to Gain Real-World Experience?If you’re a forward-thinking Junior or Senior looking to take the next step in your academic and professional journey, we encourage you to apply! Join Boltflow and be a part of an innovative team that is shaping the future of automation.
Requirements: 🎓 Currently enrolled Junior or Senior in a university program. 🗣️ Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with potential leads. 💪 A desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced tech environment. ⏰ Effective time management skills , balancing academic responsibilities with this flexible internship. ❤️ Passion for technology and a genuine interest in no-code platforms and automation., , If you’re a forward-thinking Junior or Senior looking to take the next step in your academic and professional journey, we encourage you to apply! Join Boltflow and be a part of an innovative team that is shaping the future of automation.

description: We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented UX/UI/Graphic Design Intern (Unpaid) to join our innovative team at Find Me. This position offers an excellent opportunity for individuals passionate about design to gain practical experience in developing user-centered mobile and web applications, progressing from initial concepts to interactive prototypes while working in a team.Key Responsibilities:Create low-fidelity and high-fidelity wireframes for mobile apps and websites, ensuring a seamless user experience.Develop functional interactive prototypes in Figma to effectively communicate design ideas to developers.Establish design and typographical hierarchy while selecting cohesive color palettes to enhance visual communication.Design icons and logos using Adobe Illustrator and Figma, aligning with brand identity.Edit and enhance images in Photoshop to create visually compelling content.Conduct user research and develop comprehensive project briefs to inform design decisions.Collaborate closely with a hands-on team of UX/UI designers and the company founder, participating in daily video calls and contributing to shared documents to facilitate teamwork.Schedule:Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time (EST), from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM.Requirements:Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Adobe CC, and Microsoft Office Suite.Demonstrated experience and focus in UX/UI and graphic design for mobile applications and websites.Ability to create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and various design elements.Strong understanding of design principles, including hierarchy, color theory, and layout.Exceptional attention to detail and effective communication skills.Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant academic program (preferred).Benefits:Gain hands-on experience in UX/UI and graphic design within a dynamic startup environment.Opportunity to work on real-world projects and build a robust design portfolio.Collaborate with a passionate team dedicated to innovative design solutions.Potential for academic credit based on program approval.How to Apply: Interested candidates should send their resume, a brief cover letter explaining their interest and relevant experience, and examples of prior projects to HR@fyndme.net.Join us and be a part of an exciting journey to shape the future of web and mobile application design!Note: This is an unpaid internship with the possibility of academic credits and a potential full-time position based on performance.
Requirements: Create low-fidelity and high-fidelity wireframes for mobile apps and websites, ensuring a seamless user experience. Develop functional interactive prototypes in Figma to effectively communicate design ideas to developers. Establish design and typographical hierarchy while selecting cohesive color palettes to enhance visual communication. Design icons and logos using Adobe Illustrator and Figma, aligning with brand identity. Edit and enhance images in Photoshop to create visually compelling content. Conduct user research and develop comprehensive project briefs to inform design decisions. Collaborate closely with a hands-on team of UX/UI designers and the company founder, participating in daily video calls and contributing to shared documents to facilitate teamwork., Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Adobe CC, and Microsoft Office Suite. Demonstrated experience and focus in UX/UI and graphic design for mobile applications and websites. Ability to create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and various design elements. Strong understanding of design principles, including hierarchy, color theory, and layout. Exceptional attention to detail and effective communication skills. Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant academic program (preferred).

description: Job Summary The Sales, Services and Support (S3) Academy is designed for entry-level talent. It includes a robust 90 day training, business integration support, and other tailored programs to promote professional development and community. During this training, Academy Participants gain the foundational knowledge needed to have a basic understanding of the Storage Industry, NetApp, and products and solutions. Additionally, they effectively develop transferable soft skills that will allow them to excel within the organization and in their long- term careers. In this position your overall focus areas will be in supporting and developing processes and systems for quick and thorough responses to customer RFP's, provide systems configuration recommendations, and apply your background and experience to deliver solutions to technical problems. You will work directly with the NetApp Sales team to support customers in pre-sales and post sales situations, and to work effectively across functions with other NetApp employees in Sales, Marketing, Customer Service and Development areas. Specific responsibilities include:Assist in identifying customer needs and requirementsDefine elements of a customer's technical computing environment as assigned by sales reps or senior-level SE'sAnswer customer questionsProvide technical support to current customers and 'try-and-buy' test projectsHelp define customer acceptance criteria for 'try-and-buy' evaluation projectsPick up and deliver NetApp evaluation test system to the customer siteAttend customer calls with the Sales RepresentativeProvide technical consultation and disseminate product information to the sales team Job Requirements Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal communication and customer service skills are needed in order work successfully with prospects, customers, and cross-functional teams to meet performance goalsStrong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer-facing environmentAbility to follow standard engineering principles and practices.Creative approach to problem-solvingTravel to the prospective customer's sites as necessaryOpen-minded and positive attitudeWillingness to learn and adapt to changing environments Education No industry-relevant experience is required for this position. Candidates who have acquired basic knowledge or skills through education, internships or relevant coursework will be considered.Additional Details Job Posting Info: This is a pipeline position that will be opened on a recurring basis and used to fill roles aligned with the required skill sets. Recruiting efforts will be ongoing until specific teams find an ideal match. Thrive Together: In-office interactions are critical to achieving stronger, more integrated results. NetApp introduced Thrive Together to support increased in-office engagements globally. Thrive Together is an intentional progression of the company’s approach to hybrid work designed to foster stronger connections and collaboration and drive enhanced business performance. CompensationThe base salary range for this position is $83,000 - $117,000 and will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off (PTO), various Leave options, Performance-Based Incentives, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s), with all offerings subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. Benefits may vary by country and region, and further details will be provided as part of the recruitment process. Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know...Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.
Requirements: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal communication and customer service skills are needed in order work successfully with prospects, customers, and cross-functional teams to meet performance goals Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer-facing environment Ability to follow standard engineering principles and practices. Creative approach to problem-solving Travel to the prospective customer's sites as necessary Open-minded and positive attitude Willingness to learn and adapt to changing environments,

description: DRB Systems (“DRB”) is the leading provider of technology-enabled devices and software solutions to the North American car wash industry. The HR Intern is responsible for running multiple projects supporting DRB product line.JOB PURPOSE:Are you a proactive and eager learner looking to kickstart your career in Human Resources? The HR Intern will assist the HR Team with recruitment, planning, and engagement. This role will provide valuable exposure and experience in many aspects of Human Resources. If you're passionate about HR and ready to dive into the world of talent management, then you will love being an HR/TA Intern at DRB! This role reports directly to the Talent Acquisition Partner.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of these essential functions at a satisfactorily level. Other essential and non-essential functions may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Assist with recruiting activities and intake meetings· Partner on local employee engagement activities· Assist Talent Acquisition and HR in day-to-day activities· Shadow/overview the HR Generalist and HRBP role· Requisition management and workflow processes· Work with HR on leaves of absence/unemployment processes· Aid in audits for benefits and payroll· Other duties as assigned MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:Skill Sets: A Rising Junior or Rising Senior pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or related fieldMust have the ability to handle confidential information, issues, and decisionsAbility to adapt to different social settingsExcellent communication skills, written and oral Vontier (NYSE: VNT) is a global industrial technology company uniting productivity, automation and multi-energy technologies to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving, more connected mobility ecosystem. Leveraging leading market positions, decades of domain expertise and unparalleled portfolio breadth, Vontier enables the way the world moves – delivering smart, safe and sustainable solutions to our customers and the planet. Vontier has a culture of continuous improvement and innovation built upon the foundation of the Vontier Business System and embraced by colleagues worldwide. Additional information about Vontier is available on the Company’s website at www.vontier.com.The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Vontier Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as “Vontier Company”.Vontier is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strive to build inclusive environments and ensure equitable access, opportunity, and treatment for all. Vontier does not tolerate discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, gender identity or expression, gender information and any other characteristics protected by law. We make hiring decisions based on your experience and skills. Vontier is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation in the application or interview process, you may contact us at e-mail vnttalentacquisition@vontier.com. Equal Opportunity Employer

Other essential and non-essential functions may be assigned. description: Want to be part of a mission to improve people's lives by providing the fastest internet on the planet?You’ll join a Team at a well-capitalized technology startup with more than 200 employees.Planet Networks is filled with humble, life-long learners who are eager to help one another, and the company succeed. We value what we do for our communities and hold ourselves to the highest standard as we disrupt the vast telecommunications industry.What You’ll Do:Participate in sales meetings to help present our services and benefits to potential customers.Support senior sales staff in driving new business opportunities and nurturing existing relationships.Contribute to lead generation efforts by networking and engaging with industry professionals.Perform customer analytics initiatives and data-driven marketing analysis.Assist in managing customer projects and ensure all sales activities are logged accurately into our CRM system.Who You Are:Previous experience in sales, customer service, or related fields is preferred but not required.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Self-motivated with a positive attitude and a desire to achieve goals.Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.Must be comfortable with door-to-door sales and engaging with the public.Basic knowledge of internet and technology services is a plus.Benefits & Compensation:Competitive PayCommissionsEquity CompensationHealth Insurance: Medical, Dental, and VisionLife Insurance401K MatchingPaid Holidays & Vacation (PTO)

description: About the Company:Horizon Labs started with a dream to build the modern version of Thomas Edison’s Lab for the new AI world, where ideas can be rapidly tested under one roof and scaled for growth. We look for problems in the world that have AI solutions guided by the belief that AI is not just a tool but a paradigm shift, democratizing technology and providing startups with unprecedented opportunities for growth and success.Our unique model involves incubating the idea, assembling the team, launching the startup, and supporting growth throughout the lifecycle. We aim to cultivate enduring relationships within our network and team of entrepreneurs, fostering a community of like-minded individuals who share our passion for pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.The Role:We're seeking an Entrepreneur in Residence (EIR) Intern to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in our startup creation process. As an EIR, you will work closely with our Managing Director, Charlie Hung (former Managing Director of Rocket Internet China) and a diverse team to ideate, validate, and launch new ventures leveraging the power of AI.Key Responsibilities:Ideate and conceptualize innovative startup ideas within strategic focus areas.Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and feasibility studies to assess the viability of potential ventures.Develop business models, go-to-market strategies, and financial projections for new startup concepts.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build MVPs (Minimum Viable Products) and iterate based on user feedback.Drive the execution of startup launches, including product development, marketing, and customer acquisition strategies. Who we’re looking for:Entrepreneurial: You have an entrepreneurial mindset with a keen interest in start-ups and technology displayed through deep knowledge and, if applicable, previous start-up work experiencePassionate: You're passionate about leveraging technology, particularly AI, to drive innovation and create positive impact.Collaborative: You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working closely with cross-functional teams to bring ideas to life.Growth Mindset: You can effectively work in an independent, structured and goal-oriented manner, while being growth-minded and ambitiousStrategic Thinker: You possess analytical, creative and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to identify market opportunities and formulate innovative business strategies.Strong Communication Skills: You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and concepts effectively.If you're an entrepreneurial-minded individual with a passion for innovation and a drive to make a difference, we'd love to hear from you.
Requirements: , Ideate and conceptualize innovative startup ideas within strategic focus areas. Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and feasibility studies to assess the viability of potential ventures. Develop business models, go-to-market strategies, and financial projections for new startup concepts. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build MVPs (Minimum Viable Products) and iterate based on user feedback. Drive the execution of startup launches, including product development, marketing, and customer acquisition strategies., Entrepreneurial: You have an entrepreneurial mindset with a keen interest in start-ups and technology displayed through deep knowledge and, if applicable, previous start-up work experience Passionate: You're passionate about leveraging technology, particularly AI, to drive innovation and create positive impact. Collaborative: You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working closely with cross-functional teams to bring ideas to life. Growth Mindset: You can effectively work in an independent, structured and goal-oriented manner, while being growth-minded and ambitious Strategic Thinker: You possess analytical, creative and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to identify market opportunities and formulate innovative business strategies. Strong Communication Skills: You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and concepts effectively. If you're an entrepreneurial-minded individual with a passion for innovation and a drive to make a difference, we'd love to hear from you.

description: I am seeking an accounting major, working toward their CPA or someone who has a CPA to intern in my tax practice. The practice has a concentration in tax preparation, however, we perform, payroll, bookkeeping, reviews and audits along with special projects. I offer mentorship and training, with a skilled staff and a relaxed work culture. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, a future partnership is a good possibility. You will be given increasing responsibility and grow as a professional at a rapid rate. You must be skilled in MSOffice, internet searches of complex subject matter and the position is in my office in Grasonville. A willingness to learn at work and retain subject matter is important. The ability to bring in clients is a plus. Internet marketing skills and a good personality are also relevant to being on a partner track. Having an organized mindset, managing people and processes and a professional demeanor are required.

description: From zero trust architecture and cloud delivery to security automation and beyond, Easy Dynamics delivers cutting-edge innovation and steady guidance in an ever-changing IT landscape and we’re growing. Come join our team! We are looking for a lead Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO)! The ISSO will play a key role in the protection of critical government information systems and data, both on-premises and in cloud environments.We are a fast-paced organization that values our people and always strives for excellence. Our delivery practices lean heavily on Agile methodology and our technologists are top notch. The Easy Dynamics culture is one of connection and collaboration across teams to ensure that we always put our best foot forward. Being in growth mode means that we are small enough that no idea is too small for discussion, and everyone can be an impact player. Responsibilities:Deep Experience and Expertise with cloud security, compliance, and accreditationServe as a key advisor to Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), System Owners (SO), and varied security stakeholders.Responsible for implementing, managing, and maintaining security controls in compliance with federal regulations and frameworks such as FISMA, NIST, and FedRAMP.Provide continuous monitoring, incident management, and risk mitigation for both traditional IT infrastructure and cloud services.Stay updated on public sector regulations, compliance requirements, and industry trends as an ongoing practice.Participates, conducts, and presents in security meetings, workgroups, or training events.Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in related discipline or 8 years of relevant work experience in cybersecurity or ISSO rolesMust have at least 6 years of experience in information security, cybersecurity, or ISSO rolesMust hold any TWO of the following Required Certifications:Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) orCertified Information Security Manager (CISM) orCompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+)Preferred candidates will also hold any of the following Optional Specialty Certifications:AWS Certified Security – Specialty (if the role involves managing cloud environments, particularly in AWS)Other Applicable Certifications:Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) (if the role involves security auditing or compliance).CompTIA Security+ (for broader information security foundational requirements).Strong analytical, task management, time management, and communication skills necessary for handling security and risk management initiatives, tasks, and deadlines impacting the customer’s environmentEffective technical writing skills; experience writing risk management documentation e.g. Plans, SOPs, POA&Ms, policies, guidance, change management request, business cases, security incident reports, risk waivers, remediation action plans, and SA&A-required documentation using the Microsoft Office suiteAble to properly understand, interpret and communicate level of effort, define due dates, and meet deadlines.Hardworking and self-motivated, with the ability to work in team and individual settings.Be able to work remotely but, be able to go on-site as requested and/or occasionally with potentially some form of post-pandemic cadence, on-site in Washington DCSalary Range: $110,000 - $145,000
Requirements: Deep Experience and Expertise with cloud security, compliance, and accreditation Serve as a key advisor to Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), System Owners (SO), and varied security stakeholders. Responsible for implementing, managing, and maintaining security controls in compliance with federal regulations and frameworks such as FISMA, NIST, and FedRAMP. Provide continuous monitoring, incident management, and risk mitigation for both traditional IT infrastructure and cloud services. Stay updated on public sector regulations, compliance requirements, and industry trends as an ongoing practice. Participates, conducts, and presents in security meetings, workgroups, or training events., Bachelor's Degree in related discipline or 8 years of relevant work experience in cybersecurity or ISSO roles Must have at least 6 years of experience in information security, cybersecurity, or ISSO roles Must hold any TWO of the following Required Certifications: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) or CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+) Preferred candidates will also hold any of the following Optional Specialty Certifications: AWS Certified Security – Specialty (if the role involves managing cloud environments, particularly in AWS) Other Applicable Certifications: Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) (if the role involves security auditing or compliance). CompTIA Security+ (for broader information security foundational requirements). Strong analytical, task management, time management, and communication skills necessary for handling security and risk management initiatives, tasks, and deadlines impacting the customer’s environment Effective technical writing skills; experience writing risk management documentation e.g. Plans, SOPs, POA&Ms, policies, guidance, change management request, business cases, security incident reports, risk waivers, remediation action plans, and SA&A-required documentation using the Microsoft Office suite Able to properly understand, interpret and communicate level of effort, define due dates, and meet deadlines. Hardworking and self-motivated, with the ability to work in team and individual settings. Be able to work remotely but, be able to go on-site as requested and/or occasionally with potentially some form of post-pandemic cadence, on-site in Washington DC Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) or CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+) AWS Certified Security – Specialty (if the role involves managing cloud environments, particularly in AWS) Other Applicable Certifications: Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) (if the role involves security auditing or compliance). CompTIA Security+ (for broader information security foundational requirements).

description: Accounting RepresentativeComputer Packages Inc., a private company and world leader in intellectual property software, is seeking an Accounting Rep. to work full time at our office in Rockville, MD. Will train a highly motivated individual, however some accounting experience and strong computer skills are preferred. Bachelor's degree or upcoming graduate preferred. Duties include assisting with client invoicing, accounts receivable, updating data, scanning and searching documents, annual government surveys, reporting and other tasks. Excellent salary and benefits including health, dental, vision, 401k, tuition, visa sponsorship, relocation, and strong opportunity for growth.

description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join UsCreation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Team IntroductionOur engineering team is responsible for developing state-of-the-art machine learning models and algorithms to protect our platform and users from the content and behaviors that violate community guidelines and related local regulations. With the continuous efforts from our team, TikTok is able to provide the best user experience and bring joy to everyone in the world.1. Build industry-leading content safety systems for TikTok;2. Develop highly-scalable classifiers, tools, models and algorithms leveraging cutting-edge machine learning, computer vision and data mining technologies;3. Understand product objectives and improve trust and safety strategy and model's performance;4. Work with cross-functional teams to protect TikTok globally. We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2024. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Turn your ambitions into reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.This Internship Program runs for 10-24 weeks. Candidates can also apply for both Off-cycle Intern position and Program Intern position.Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early. Responsibilities• Build industry-leading content safety systems for TikTok.• Develop highly-scalable classifiers, tools, models and algorithms leveraging cutting-edge machine learning, computer vision and data mining technologies.• Understand product objectives and improve trust and safety strategy and model's performance.• Work with cross-functional teams to protect TikTok globally. Qualifications• Currently pursuing a BS/MS/PhD degree in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline.• Solid experience in at least one of the following areas: recommendation system, machine learning, pattern recognition, NLP, data mining, or computer vision.• Experience in recommendation, search, advertising, or other related projects.• Published papers in the top AI conferences or journals is a plus, including KDD, IJCAI, WWW, WSDM, ICML, NeurIPS, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, ACL, etc.• Competition experience in machine learning, data mining, CV, NLP, etc.• Good understanding of data structures and algorithms.• Passion for techniques and solving challenging problems.• Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. Preferred Qualifications• Graduating December 2024 onwards with the intent to return to degree program after the completion of the internship.• High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy. Job Information【BC - For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description Intern (annually)The base salary range for this position in the selected city is CAD$ 108168 - CAD$ 108168 annually. ​The compensation for this position is based on a monthly compensation structure. The range specified is the expected annual compensation for a person in this position.​Our time off and leave plans are: Paid holidays, vacation and paid sick leave. The sick leave entitlement is based on the time you join.​

Candidates can also apply for both Off-cycle Intern position and Program Intern position.Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early. Responsibilities• Build industry-leading content safety systems for TikTok.• Develop highly-scalable classifiers, tools, models and algorithms leveraging cutting-edge machine learning, computer vision and data mining technologies.• Understand product objectives and improve trust and safety strategy and model's performance.• Work with cross-functional teams to protect TikTok globally. Qualifications• Currently pursuing a BS/MS/PhD degree in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline.• Solid experience in at least one of the following areas: recommendation system, machine learning, pattern recognition, NLP, data mining, or computer vision.• Experience in recommendation, search, advertising, or other related projects.• Published papers in the top AI conferences or journals is a plus, including KDD, IJCAI, WWW, WSDM, ICML, NeurIPS, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, ACL, etc.• Competition experience in machine learning, data mining, CV, NLP, etc.• Good understanding of data structures and algorithms.• Passion for techniques and solving challenging problems.• Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. Preferred Qualifications• Graduating December 2024 onwards with the intent to return to degree program after the completion of the internship.• High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy. Job Information【BC - For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description Intern (annually)The base salary range for this position in the selected city is CAD$ 108168 - CAD$ 108168 annually. ​The compensation for this position is based on a monthly compensation structure. The range specified is the expected annual compensation for a person in this position.​Our time off and leave plans are: Paid holidays, vacation and paid sick leave. The sick leave entitlement is based on the time you join.​

Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.Proficiency in Figma for designing and prototyping.Basic understanding of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).Strong portfolio demonstrating methodologies.Preferred Qualifications:Understanding of accessibility standards and best practices.Experience with user testing and usability analysis.Core Competencies Developed:Design Thinking: to work effectively in a team environment, including remote collaboration.Communication: Improve your ability to articulate design decisions and collaborate across different disciplines.Compliance: This internship complies with the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) guidelines, offering a structured educational experience with clear learning outcomes and hands-on training.Application Process: description: Networking Engineer Intern - Unpaid About Us:Find Me is an innovative startup focused on creating cutting-edge applications. We are currently in the designing phase and gearing up to launch our product soon. Our team is passionate about technology and driven to make a difference in the IT field. Located in the United States, we offer remote work flexibility to our team members. Job Overview:We are seeking a skilled Network Engineer to support the development and maintenance of our mobile applications. As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the network infrastructure necessary for reliable and secure mobile app operations. This includes optimizing network performance, ensuring secure data transmission, and troubleshooting network issues to guarantee a seamless user experience. Key Responsibilities:- Design, deploy, and manage network infrastructure that supports mobile app operations, including load balancers, firewalls, VPNs, and security protocols.- Collaborate with mobile development and backend teams to ensure proper integration of network components, APIs, and cloud services.- Optimize mobile app network performance by configuring CDN (Content Delivery Networks), DNS, and network routing for minimal latency and maximum availability.- Monitor network traffic, perform security assessments, and implement measures to secure data transmission between mobile clients and backend services.- Troubleshoot network issues affecting mobile apps, identify root causes and implement long-term solutions.- Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to configure network settings, VPCs (Virtual Private Clouds), and hybrid cloud environments for mobile apps.- Implement and maintain VPNs and secure tunnels to ensure data encryption for sensitive information.- Provide technical guidance for network architecture, protocols, and security best practices to ensure compliance with industry standards.- Participate in network-related testing and validation, including load testing, network stress tests, and failover simulations. Required Qualifications:- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Network Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.- 3+ years of experience as a Network Engineer, with a focus on supporting mobile app environments.- Strong knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SSL/TLS, VPNs) and network security.- Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), including configuring VPCs, network security groups, and load balancers.- Proficiency with network monitoring and diagnostic tools (e.g., Wireshark, SolarWinds, Nagios, or similar).- Hands-on experience with firewall configurations, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and DDoS protection.- Familiarity with CDN services, DNS configuration, and mobile app-specific network optimizations. Preferred Qualifications:- Certification in networking (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, CompTIA Network+, AWS Certified Advanced Networking).- Experience with mobile app development frameworks (React Native, Swift, Kotlin) and how they impact network design. Skillset Required:Strong knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SSL/TLS, VPNs)Experience in designing, deploying, and managing network infrastructure (load balancers, firewalls, VPNs, security protocols)Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and configuring VPCs and hybrid cloud environmentsProficiency with network performance optimization, including CDN configuration, DNS, and routing to minimize latencyExpertise in network traffic monitoring and performing security assessmentsHands-on experience with firewall configurations and network security toolsAbility to troubleshoot network issues and implement long-term solutionsKnowledge of data encryption techniques and maintaining secure tunnels (VPNs)Experience with network architecture design and providing technical guidance for best practicesFamiliarity with load testing, network stress tests, and failover simulationsProficiency with network monitoring tools (e.g., Wireshark, SolarWinds, Nagios) Benefits:Gain hands-on experience in product management within a startup environment.Opportunity to earn academic credits.Chance to convert this internship into a full-time role based on performance.Work with a dynamic and innovative team in a fast-growing startup. How to Apply:To apply, please send your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this opportunity to hr@fyndme.net. We look forward to seeing your work and how you can contribute to the future of retail technology. Note: This is an unpaid internship with the possibility of academic credits and a potential full-time position based on performance.
Requirements: - Design, deploy, and manage network infrastructure that supports mobile app operations, including load balancers, firewalls, VPNs, and security protocols. - Collaborate with mobile development and backend teams to ensure proper integration of network components, APIs, and cloud services. - Optimize mobile app network performance by configuring CDN (Content Delivery Networks), DNS, and network routing for minimal latency and maximum availability. - Monitor network traffic, perform security assessments, and implement measures to secure data transmission between mobile clients and backend services. - Troubleshoot network issues affecting mobile apps, identify root causes and implement long-term solutions. - Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to configure network settings, VPCs (Virtual Private Clouds), and hybrid cloud environments for mobile apps. - Implement and maintain VPNs and secure tunnels to ensure data encryption for sensitive information. - Provide technical guidance for network architecture, protocols, and security best practices to ensure compliance with industry standards. - Participate in network-related testing and validation, including load testing, network stress tests, and failover simulations., - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Network Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. - 3+ years of experience as a Network Engineer, with a focus on supporting mobile app environments. - Strong knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SSL/TLS, VPNs) and network security. - Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), including configuring VPCs, network security groups, and load balancers. - Proficiency with network monitoring and diagnostic tools (e.g., Wireshark, SolarWinds, Nagios, or similar). - Hands-on experience with firewall configurations, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and DDoS protection. - Familiarity with CDN services, DNS configuration, and mobile app-specific network optimizations., - Certification in networking (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, CompTIA Network+, AWS Certified Advanced Networking). - Experience with mobile app development frameworks (React Native, Swift, Kotlin) and how they impact network design.

description: Job Summary The Sales, Services and Support (S3) Academy is designed or entry-level talent. It includes a robust 90 day training, business integration support, and other tailored programs to promote professional development and community. During this training, Academy Participants gain the foundational knowledge needed to have a basic understanding of the Storage Industry, NetApp, and products and solutions. Additionally, they effectively develop transferable soft skills that will allow them to excel within the organization and in their long- term careers. As a Services Associate in the S3 Academy at NetApp, your goal is to learn the innerworkings of the Professional Services organization. A wide variety of roles are essential to ensure the NetApp Services is the standard of excellence:Services Sales Associate - has the pre-sales responsibility for opportunity qualification, assessments, scoping, and sizing which requires excellent communication skills to become the point of contact for the customer.Professional Services Resident - expected to collaborate with the PS team to assist NetApp customers through on-site support and consulting services.Professional Services Engineer/Consultant - meet the requirements of Enterprise clients by providing and deploying technical architectures that deliver the highest value add on NetApp solutions.Project Manager - hands-on individual with a combination of business and technical leadership skills. Responsible for planning, scheduling, tracking, and supervising the delivery of a wide range of projectsProduct Manager - evaluates business opportunities to define and optimize the product portfolio through analysis and understanding of targeted markets, market trends, new technology, customer business issues, and the competitive market. Job Requirements and Responsibilities Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal relationship-building skillsAbility to problem solve and critically analyze situationsIdentify and influence the continuous improvement of key business processes resulting in improved customer experience.Work closely with the sales team to present solutions to customers’ unique requirements.Develop a support and professional services plan as a part of the overall account plan to meet NetApp’s professional services objectivesPosition and deliver company-marketed solution sets and other custom consultingWork collaboratively with other engineers and managers in a team environment to meet aggressive goals and high-quality standardsManage a variety of projects to time, budget, quality, and contracted deliverablesOpen-minded and positive attitudeWillingness to learn and adapt to changing environments Experience No industry-relevant experience is required for this position. Candidates who have acquired basic knowledge or skills through education, internships or relevant coursework will be considered. Additional Details: Job Posting Info: This is a pipeline position that will be opened on a recurring basis and used to fill roles aligned with the required skill sets. Recruiting efforts will be ongoing until specific teams find an ideal match. Thrive Together: In-office interactions are critical to achieving stronger, more integrated results. NetApp introduced Thrive Together to support increased in-office engagements globally. Thrive Together is an intentional progression of the company’s approach to hybrid work designed to foster stronger connections and collaboration and drive enhanced business performance. CompensationThe base salary range for this position is $86,000 - $121,000 and will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off (PTO), various Leave options, Performance-Based Incentives, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s), with all offerings subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. Benefits may vary by country and region, and further details will be provided as part of the recruitment process. Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know...Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.
Requirements: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal relationship-building skills Ability to problem solve and critically analyze situations Identify and influence the continuous improvement of key business processes resulting in improved customer experience. Work closely with the sales team to present solutions to customers’ unique requirements. Develop a support and professional services plan as a part of the overall account plan to meet NetApp’s professional services objectives Position and deliver company-marketed solution sets and other custom consulting Work collaboratively with other engineers and managers in a team environment to meet aggressive goals and high-quality standards Manage a variety of projects to time, budget, quality, and contracted deliverables Open-minded and positive attitude Willingness to learn and adapt to changing environments, No industry-relevant experience is required for this position.  Candidates who have acquired basic knowledge or skills through education, internships or relevant coursework will be considered.

During this training, Academy Participants gain the foundational knowledge needed to have a basic understanding of the Storage Industry, NetApp, and products and solutions. Additionally, they effectively develop transferable soft skills that will allow them to excel within the organization and in their long- term careers. As a Services Associate in the S3 Academy at NetApp, your goal is to learn the innerworkings of the Professional Services organization. A wide variety of roles are essential to ensure the NetApp Services is the standard of excellence:Services Sales Associate - has the pre-sales responsibility for opportunity qualification, assessments, scoping, and sizing which requires excellent communication skills to become the point of contact for the customer.Professional Services Resident - expected to collaborate with the PS team to assist NetApp customers through on-site support and consulting services.Professional Services Engineer/Consultant - meet the requirements of Enterprise clients by providing and deploying technical architectures that deliver the highest value add on NetApp solutions.Project Manager - hands-on individual with a combination of business and technical leadership skills. Responsible for planning, scheduling, tracking, and supervising the delivery of a wide range of projectsProduct Manager - evaluates business opportunities to define and optimize the product portfolio through analysis and understanding of targeted markets, market trends, new technology, customer business issues, and the competitive market. Job Requirements and Responsibilities Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal relationship-building skillsAbility to problem solve and critically analyze situationsIdentify and influence the continuous improvement of key business processes resulting in improved customer experience.Work closely with the sales team to present solutions to customers’ unique requirements.Develop a support and professional services plan as a part of the overall account plan to meet NetApp’s professional services objectivesPosition and deliver company-marketed solution sets and other custom consultingWork collaboratively with other engineers and managers in a team environment to meet aggressive goals and high-quality standardsManage a variety of projects to time, budget, quality, and contracted deliverablesOpen-minded and positive attitudeWillingness to learn and adapt to changing environments Experience No industry-relevant experience is required for this position.  Candidates who have acquired basic knowledge or skills through education, internships or relevant coursework will be considered.  Additional Details: Job Posting Info: This is a pipeline position that will be opened on a recurring basis and used to fill roles aligned with the required skill sets. Recruiting efforts will be ongoing until specific teams find an ideal match.  Thrive Together: In-office interactions are critical to achieving stronger, more integrated results. NetApp introduced Thrive Together to support increased in-office engagements globally. Thrive Together is an intentional progression of the company’s approach to hybrid work designed to foster stronger connections and collaboration and drive enhanced business performance. CompensationThe base salary range for this position is $86,000 - $121,000 and will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off (PTO), various Leave options, Performance-Based Incentives, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s), with all offerings subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. Benefits may vary by country and region, and further details will be provided as part of the recruitment process. Equal Opportunity Employer:NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification. Did you know...Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you. Why NetApp?We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

description: Hello! Thank you for taking time to review this opportunity.Company Overview: The Creative Bomb is a leading mobile app and web development company specializing in innovative and custom app/web solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are committed to delivering high-quality, user-friendly mobile applications that drive business growth and enhance user experiences.Location: RemoteOverview: This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in sales and marketing earning a base salary of $500 per month while earning commission for every successful lead or sale you generate. We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Sales and Marketing Intern to join our team on a commission-only basis. If you are a self-starter with a passion for technology and a knack for sales, we want to hear from you!Responsibilities:Identify and generate new business opportunities through various channels (e.g., social media, phone calls, email campaigns, networking events).Conduct market research to identify potential clients and industries for our mobile app development services.Reach out to potential clients to present our services and identify their needs.Track and report on sales performance, including leads generated, sales closed, and commissions earned.Base Salary: We offer a base salary of $500 per monthCommission Structure:Earn a competitive commission for each successful lead or sale. This means even generating an incoming email to The Creative Bomb that leads into a sale, you are paid the commission.Our sales range between $5,000 and $250,000 per project acquired.Commission structure:10% commission on sales.Commission example:Your lead generates a $50,000 sale, you earn $5,000.Learning Opportunities:Gain hands-on experience in sales and marketing within the tech industry.Develop valuable skills in lead generation, client relationship management, and sales strategy.Opportunity to work closely with experienced professionals and receive mentorship.Expand your professional network within the tech and startup community.Qualifications:Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant degree program (e.g., Business, Marketing, Communications).Strong interest in sales and marketing within the tech industry.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Self-motivated with a strong work ethic and ability to work independently.Basic understanding of mobile app/web development is a plus but not required.Work Hours:Flexible work hours with a minimum commitment of 20 hours per week.Remote position, allowing you to work from anywhere.Duration:1-month internship with the possibility of extension based on performance and mutual agreement. Open to negotiation.
Requirements: Identify and generate new business opportunities through various channels (e.g., social media, phone calls, email campaigns, networking events). Conduct market research to identify potential clients and industries for our mobile app development services. Reach out to potential clients to present our services and identify their needs. Track and report on sales performance, including leads generated, sales closed, and commissions earned., Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant degree program (e.g., Business, Marketing, Communications). Strong interest in sales and marketing within the tech industry. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Self-motivated with a strong work ethic and ability to work independently. Basic understanding of mobile app/web development is a plus but not required.

job_title: Summer Internship Program - Fort Lauderdale, FL Based
description: Here at Commvault, what you do matters! Each summer, college students join Commvault as part of our Summer Internship Program, gaining invaluable experience in a dynamic, global technology company. As a “Vaultern,” you will play a vital role in helping our customers achieve cyber resilience amidst evolving digital threats. Our program offers a comprehensive experience that includes real, impactful work on projects that drive business success, develop meaningful connections with executive leaders and mentors, and participate in professional development activities. You’ll have the opportunity to showcase your skills and learnings during our intern project contest and participate in community service through our “Commvault Cares” volunteering initiative. This internship is designed to be a transformative experience for both interns and Commvault employees. From learning sessions and executive interactions, to contributing to critical initiatives and community outreach, as a Vaultern you will gain hands-on experience and forge valuable relationships that will shape your careers. Join us this summer as a Commvault Vaultern and take the next step in your journey to becoming a future leader in technology. Apply now to make an impact, build connections, and grow with us! Eligibility RequirementsBe at least 17 years of age prior to scheduled start date.Be currently enrolled at an accredited institution.​​Be enrolled at an accredited institution the semester immediately following the summer internship program (Fall 2025). Please submit your application and resume through this site: https://careers.commvault.com/us/en/search-results?keywords=interns

description: Product Manager (Unpaid) Find Me, United States (Remote)About Us: Find Me is an innovative startup focused on creating cutting-edge applications. We are currently in the designing phase and gearing up to launch our product soon. Our team is passionate about technology and driven to make a difference in the IT field. Position Overview: We are seeking an experienced Product Manager with at least 5 years of experience and industrial knowledge in areas such as AWS, Azure, frontend development, backend development, and design tools like Figma and Adobe applications. As a Product Manager, you will play a critical role in managing multiple projects related to the development and deployment of our application. Responsibilities:Lead the product development process from ideation to deployment, ensuring alignment with company goals.Work closely with the engineering team to define product requirements and manage the development process.Oversee the design and development of both frontend and backend components of the application.Manage the product lifecycle, including planning, development, and release.Collaborate with stakeholders, including designers, developers, and marketing teams, to ensure successful product delivery.Create and maintain product roadmaps, ensuring timely delivery of features.Monitor industry trends and competitor products to ensure our product stays competitive.Manage product documentation, including technical specs, user guides, and release notes.Facilitate Agile practices within the team, ensuring continuous improvement and effective delivery.Communicate progress and updates to the executive team and other stakeholders.Skills and Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field required; MBA or equivalent desirable.Three or more years of product management experience.Detail-oriented and thrive in a collaborative environment.Strong analytical and organizational skills, with excellent oral and written communication skills.Problem-solving aptitude and creative thinking skills.Product lifecycle management experience.Background in software development and program management.Experience in Agile teams. Strong background in the following technologies:REST API designWeb developmentSketch and/or Adobe productsAgile software deliveryPowerPointSQLSoftware architectureCSS & HTMLJavaScriptTechnical documentationAzure/AWS Benefits:Gain hands-on experience in product management within a startup environment.Opportunity to earn academic credits.Chance to convert this internship into a full-time role based on performance.Work with a dynamic and innovative team in a fast-growing startup. How to Apply: Interested candidates should send their resume to hr@fyndme.net. Note: This is an unpaid internship with the possibility of academic credits and a potential full-time position based on performance.
Requirements: Lead the product development process from ideation to deployment, ensuring alignment with company goals. Work closely with the engineering team to define product requirements and manage the development process. Oversee the design and development of both frontend and backend components of the application. Manage the product lifecycle, including planning, development, and release. Collaborate with stakeholders, including designers, developers, and marketing teams, to ensure successful product delivery. Create and maintain product roadmaps, ensuring timely delivery of features. Monitor industry trends and competitor products to ensure our product stays competitive. Manage product documentation, including technical specs, user guides, and release notes. Facilitate Agile practices within the team, ensuring continuous improvement and effective delivery. Communicate progress and updates to the executive team and other stakeholders., Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field required; MBA or equivalent desirable. Three or more years of product management experience. Detail-oriented and thrive in a collaborative environment. Strong analytical and organizational skills, with excellent oral and written communication skills. Problem-solving aptitude and creative thinking skills. Product lifecycle management experience. Background in software development and program management. Experience in Agile teams., REST API design Web development Sketch and/or Adobe products Agile software delivery PowerPoint SQL Software architecture CSS & HTML JavaScript Technical documentation Azure/AWS
